module.name: My Home Page
module.briefDescription:
This is the "Home Page". The top set of tabs shows the individual modules that you can access. The second row are the functions available to you in this module. If you are looking for a particular module or function you have seen during training or on someone else's machine, and it's NOT visible, then it probably means that you do not have permission for that module or function.
Permissions within the system are assigned to Roles and then Users are assigned to Roles by the System Administrator.
module.detailDescription:
The Home Page has several main features.
Welcome: This is the welcome page. Here you will see a calendar of all of your upcoming alerts in the system, as well as for users that report to you.
Mailbox: The message system is designed to support INTERNAL business messaging needs and to prepare OUTGOING emails to addresses who are already in the system. Messaging is NOT a normal email replacement. It will not send email to addresses assigned "on-the-fly" and it will not receive OUTSIDE email.
Tasks: Tasks allows you to create and assign tasks. Tasks created can be assigned to the creator of the task or an employee working in the system. This page lists the tasks present along with their priorities, due dates and age.
Action Lists: Action Lists allow you to create a list of contacts that are related in some way. For each of the contacts in a list, you can add calls, opportunities, tickets, tasks or send a message, which would correspondingly show up in their respective tabs. For example, adding a ticket to the contact would be reflected in the Ticket module.
Re-assignments: You can reassign data from one employee to another employee as long as each employee reports to you. The data can be of different types related to accounts, contacts, opportunities, activities, tickets etc, which the newly reassigned employee could view.
Settings: This feature allows you to modify the information about yourself and your location, and also change your password to the system.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: You are looking at Home Page view, which has a dashboard view of all your assigned tasks, tickets, assignments, calls you have to make, and accounts that need attention. This view is based on a time selected from the calendar; by default it shows the schedule for the next seven days. You can optionally view the calendar of those below you in your hierarchy.

features.featureDescription: You can view the accounts that need attention
You can make calls with the contact information readily accessible
You can view the tasks assigned to you
You can view the tickets assigned to you

rules.ruleDescription: You can view your calendar and the calendars of those who work for you

tips.tipDescription: Assign due dates for tasks so that you can be alerted

pageDescription.title: Mailbox
pageDescription.description: The messaging feature is designed to support INTERNAL business messaging needs and to prepare OUTGOING emails to addresses who are already in the system. Messaging is NOT a normal email replacement. It will not send email to address assigned "on-the-fly" and it will not receive OUTSIDE email.

features.featureDescription: The select button can be used to view the details, reply, forward or delete a particular message.
You can add a new message
Clicking on the message will show the details of the message
The drop down can be used to select the messages present in the inbox, sent messages, or archived ones
Sort on one of the column headers by clicking on the column of your choice

pageDescription.title: Message Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the message details, shows who sent the mail, when it was received and also the text in the mail box.

features.featureDescription: You can reply, archive, forward or delete each message by clicking the corresponding button

pageDescription.title: New Message
pageDescription.description: Sending mail to other users of the system

features.featureDescription: A new message can be composed either to the contacts or the employees present in the recipients list. The options field can be checked to send a copy to the employees task list apart from sending the employee an email.

pageDescription.title: Reply Message
pageDescription.description: This pages lets you reply to email. You can also select the list of recipients for your email by clicking the Add Recipients link.

features.featureDescription: You can send the email by clicking the send button
You can add to the list of recipients by using the link "Add Recipients"
You can click the check box to send an Internet email to the recipients
Type directly in the Body test field to modify the message

pageDescription.description: This page shows the list of recipients for whom your email has been sent to

pageDescription.title: Forward message
pageDescription.description: Each message can be forwarded to any number of recipients

features.featureDescription: You can add the list of recipients by using the link "Add Recipients" and also click the check box which would send an email to the recipients
You can send the email by clicking the send button
You can edit the message by typing directly in the Body text area

pageDescription.title: Tasks
pageDescription.description: Tasks created can be assigned to the owner/creator of the task or an employee working in the system. This page lists the tasks present along with their priorities, their due dates and age.

features.featureDescription: You can add a quick task. This task would have just the description and whether the task is personal or not
For each of the existing tasks, you can view, modify, forward or delete the tasks by clicking on the Action button, and making a selection.
You can select to view your tasks or tasks assigned by you to others working under you. Each can be viewed in three different modes. i.e. the completed tasks, uncompleted tasks or both.
You can add a detailed (advanced) task, where you can set up the priority, status, whether the task is shared or not, task assignment, give the estimated time and add some detailed notes for it.

pageDescription.title: Advanced Task
pageDescription.description: Allows an advanced task to be created

features.featureDescription: Link this task to a contact and when you look at the task list, there will be a link to the contact record next to the task, allowing you to go directly to the contact.
Filling in a Due Date will make ths task show up on that date in the Home Page calendar.
Making the task personal will hide it from your hierarchy.
You can assign a task to people lower than you in your hierarchy.
Marking a task as complete will document the task as having been done, and immediately remove it from the Task List.

pageDescription.title: Forwarding a Task
pageDescription.description: A task can be forwarded to any of the recipients. Recipients can either be users of the system or any of the contacts stored in the system. Checking the options fields check box indicates that if the recipient is a user of the system, then a copy of the task is also send to the recipient's mailbox.

features.featureDescription: Allows you to forward a task to one or more users of the system. Checking the options fields check box indicates that if the recipient is a user of the system, then a copy of the task is send to the recipient's Internet email.
The Subject line is mandatory
You can add more text to the body of the message by typing directly in the Body text area

pageDescription.title: Modify task
pageDescription.description: Allows you to modify any infomation about a task

features.featureDescription: Due dates will show on the Home Page calendar
Completing a task will remove it from the task list
You can assign a task to someone lower than you in your heirarchy
You can Add or Change the contact that this task is linked to. When viewing the task, you will be able to view the contact information with one click.

pageDescription.title: Action Lists
pageDescription.description: Action Lists allow you to create new Action Lists and assign contacts to the Action Lists created. For each of the contacts in a list, you can add a call, opportunity, ticket, task or send a message, which would correspondingly show up in their respective tabs. For example, adding a ticket to the contact would be reflected in the Ticket module.

features.featureDescription: You can also view all the in progress Action Lists, completed lists, or both together.
You can also keep track of the progress of your contacts. The number of them Completed and the Total are shown in the Progress Columns.

You can add a new Action List with a description and status. You can select the contacts for this new Action List. For each of the contacts in the Action List, you can select a corresponding action with the Action Button: view details, modify contact, add contacts or delete the Action List.

pageDescription.title: Action Contacts
pageDescription.description: This page will list out all the contacts present for the particular contact list. This also shows the status of the call, opportunity, ticket, task, or the message associated with the contact. This also shows when the contact information was last updated.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the contact name will give you a pop up with more details about the contact and also about the related folders, calls, messages and opportunities.
You can add contacts to the list and also Modify the List using "Add Contacts to list" and "Modify List" respectively.
For the Action List you can also view all the in progress contacts, completed contacts or both.

For each of the contacts you can add a call, opportunity, ticket, task or send a message, which would correspondingly appear in their respective tabs. For example, adding a ticket to the contact would be reflected in the Ticket tab.

pageDescription.title: Add Action List
pageDescription.description: Allows you to add an action list. Basically, you describe the group of contacts you will add, then visually design a query to generate the group of contacts.

features.featureDescription: Select where the contacts will come from (General Contact, Account Contacts) in the From dropdown.
Enter some search text, depending on the Operator you chose.
Choose an Operator based on the Field you chose.
Choose one of the many Field Names on which to base your query.
You can Add or Remove contacts manually with the Add/Remove Contacts link.
Add your query with the Add button at the bottom of the query frame. You can have multipe queries that make up the criteria for a group. You will get the result of all the queries.
Save the Action List and generate the list of contacts by clicking the Save button at the bottom or top of the page.

pageDescription.title: Modify Action
pageDescription.description: The Action Lists details, like the description and status of the Action Lists, can be modified.

features.featureDescription: You can check the status checkbox to indicate that the New Action List is complete.
The details of the New Action List can be saved by clicking the save button.

pageDescription.title: Re-assignments
pageDescription.description: A user can reassign data from one employee to another employee working under him. The data can be of different types related to accounts, contacts opportunities, activities, tickets etc, which the newly reassigned employee could view in his schedule.

features.featureDescription: Click Update at the bottom of the page to save your reassignment, Cancel to quit the page without saving, and Reset to reset all the fields to their defaults and start over.
Choose a User to reassign data from in the top dropdown. Only users below you in your hierarchy will be present here.

Select one or more To Users in the To User column to reassign the various assets to. The number of each type of asset available to be reassigned is shown in parentheses after the asset in the first column.

pageDescription.title: My Settings
pageDescription.description: This is the personal settings page, where you can modify the information about yourself, your location and also change your password to the system.

features.featureDescription: The location of the employee can be changed, i.e. the time zone can be changed by clicking on "Configure my location."
You can update your personal information by clicking on "Update my personal information."
You can change your password by clicking on "Change my password."

pageDescription.title: Personal Information
pageDescription.description: This page lets you update/add your personal information.

features.featureDescription: Save your changes by clicking the Update button at the top or bottom of the page. The Cancel button forgets the changes and quits the page. The Reset button resets all fields to their original values so you can start over.
The only required field is your last name, but you should fill in as much as you can to make the system as useful as possible. Email address is particularly useful.

pageDescription.title: Location Settings
pageDescription.description: You can change your location settings

features.featureDescription: The location settings can be changed by selecting the time zone from the drop down list and clicking the update button to update the settings.

pageDescription.title: Update password
pageDescription.description: Your password to the system can be changed

features.featureDescription: You can update your password by clicking on the update button.
For each of the existing tasks, you can view, modify, forward or delete the tasks by clicking on the Action button
You can add a quick task. This task would have just the description and whether the task is personal or not

You can add or update a detailed task called advanced task, wherein you can set up the priority, the status, whether the task is shared or not, also is the task assigned to self or someone working under the owner of the tasks, give the estimated time and add some detailed notes in it.
Checking the existing task's check box indicates that the particular task is completed.
You can select to view your tasks or tasks assigned by you to others. Each task can be viewed in three different modes i.e. the completed tasks, uncompleted tasks or all the tasks.

pageDescription.description: No introduction available
You can add the new Action List and also select the contacts to be present in the Action List.

features.featureDescription: You can add the new Action List here. Along with description and the status you need to select the contacts you want in this Action List. You can populate the list in two ways. The first is to use the Add/Remove contacts.
The second is to define the criteria to generate the list. Once it's generated we can add them to the selected criteria and contacts by using the add feature present.

pageDescription.title: Modify Action List
pageDescription.description: Allows you to manually add or remove contacts to or from an existing Action List.

features.featureDescription: Check new contacts to add them to your list, uncheck existing contacts to remove them from your list.
Select All Contact, My Contacts or Account Contacts from the dropdown at the top.
Finish by clicking Done at the bottom of the page.

pageDescription.description: Addition of a new Advanced task that can be assigned to the owner or any other employee working under him.

features.featureDescription: You can add or update a detailed task called advanced task, wherein you can set up a priority, status, whether the task is shared or not, also is the task assigned to you or someone working under the owner of the tasks, give the estimated time and add some detailed notes to it.

module.name: Contacts
module.briefDescription: The purpose of this module is for the users to view contacts and add new contacts. You can also search for contacts as well as export contact data.
module.detailDescription:
The Contacts module has three main features
Add: A new contact can be added into the system. The contact can be a general contact, or one that is associated with an account. All the details about the contact like the email address, phone numbers, address and some additional details can be added.
Search: Use this page to search for contacts in the system based on different filters.
Export: Contact data can be exported and displayed in different formats, and can be filtered in different ways. The Export page also lets you view the data, download it, and show the number of times the exported data has been downloaded.
Import: The contacts importer is a sophisticated tool for importing contacts into DHV CRM. Features include the ability to custom/auto map fields to application properties, perform error checking and examine import progress.

pageDescription.title: Add a Contact
pageDescription.description: A new contact can be added to the system. The contact can be a general contact, or one that is associated with an account. All the details about the contact such as the email address, phone numbers, address and some additional details can be added.

features.featureDescription: You can select the contact category using the radio button and if the contact category is someone permanently associated with an account, then you can select the contact using the "select" next to it.
You can save the details about the employee using the "Save" button.
The "Save & New" button saves the details of the employee and also opens up a blank form start another contact.
The only mandatory field is the Last Name, however, it is important to fill in as much as possible. These fields can be used for various types of queries later.
The contact type can be selected using the "select" link next to the contact type.

pageDescription.title: Search Contacts
pageDescription.description: Use this page to search for contacts in the system based on different filters

features.featureDescription: If the contact already exists in the system, you can search for that contact by name, company, title, contact type or source.

pageDescription.title: Export
pageDescription.description: Contact data can be exported and displayed in different formats, and can be filtered in different ways. The Export page also lets you view the data, download it, and shows the number of times the exported data has been downloaded.

features.featureDescription: New export data can be generated by choosing the "Generate new export" link at the top of the page
Use the dropdown to choose which data to display: the list of all the exported data in the system or only your own.
The exported data can be viewed in html format by clicking on the report name. The exported data can also be downloaded in CSV format or deleted by clicking the Select button in the action field.

pageDescription.title: Exporting data
pageDescription.description: Use this page to generate a Contacts export report.

features.featureDescription: You can add all the fields or add / delete single fields from the report by using the buttons in the middle of the page. First highlight a field on the left to add or a field on the right to delete.
Use the Up and Down buttons on the right to sort the fields.
The Subject is mandatory. Select which set of contacts the export will come from with Criteria. Select the Primary sort with the Sorting dropdown.
Click the Generate button when you are ready to generate the exported report.

pageDescription.title: Modify Contact
pageDescription.description: The details about the contact can be modified here.

features.featureDescription: You can update, cancel or reset the details of the contact using the corresponding buttons.

pageDescription.title: Call Details
pageDescription.description: The calls related to the contact are listed here along with the other details such as the length of the call and the date the call was made. You can also add a call.

features.featureDescription: You can also click on the select button under the action field to view, modify, forward or delete a call.
Clicking on the subject of the call will give complete details about the call.
You can add a call associated with a contact.

pageDescription.title: Adding a Call
pageDescription.description: A new call can be added which is associated with the contact. The type of call can be selected using the drop down list present.

features.featureDescription: The save button lets you create a new call which is associated with the call.

pageDescription.title: Opportunity Details
pageDescription.description: All the opportunities associated with the contact are shown here, with its best possible total and the when the opportunity was last modified. You can filter the different types of opportunities using the drop down.

features.featureDescription: You can click the select button under the action column for viewing, modifying and deleting an opportunity.
Clicking on the name of the opportunity will show a detailed description of the opportunity.
Choosing the different types of opportunities from the drop down can filter the display.
Add an opportunity associated with a contact.

pageDescription.title: Call Details
pageDescription.description: Calls associated with the contacts are displayed. The call details are shown with the length of the call, associated notes, alert description, alert date etc.

features.featureDescription: You can modify, delete or forward each call using the corresponding buttons.

pageDescription.title: Add a component
pageDescription.description: A component can be added to an opportunity and associated to any employee present in the system. The component type can also be selected.

features.featureDescription: The component type can be selected using the "select" button.
You can assign the component to any of the employees present using the dropdown list present.

pageDescription.title: Opportunity Details
pageDescription.description: You can view all the details about the components here, such as the status, the guess amount and the current stage. A new component can also be added to an existing opportunity.

features.featureDescription: An opportunity can be renamed or deleted using the buttons present at the bottom of the page.
Clicking on the select button lets you view, modify or delete the details about a component.
Clicking on the name of the component shows the details about that component.
Add a new component associated with the contact.

pageDescription.title: Component Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the details about the opportunity such as the probability of closing the opportunity, the current stage of the opportunity, etc.

features.featureDescription: You can modify or delete the opportunity using the modify or delete button.

pageDescription.title: Modifying call details
pageDescription.description: You can modify all the details of the calls.

features.featureDescription: The type of the call can be selected using the drop down list and all the other details related to the call are updated using the update button.

pageDescription.description: The selected message is displayed with the message text and attachments, if any.

features.featureDescription: You can click the attachments or the surveys link present along with the message text.

pageDescription.description: This page shows the details of an opportunity, such as the probability of closing the opportunity, the current stage of the opportunity, etc.

features.featureDescription: You can modify or delete the opportunity using the modify or the delete button.

pageDescription.title: List of Contacts
pageDescription.description: This page shows the list of contacts in the system. The name of the contact along with the company name and phone numbers are shown. If the name of the contact is an account, it's shown right next to it. You can also add a contact.

features.featureDescription: You can also click the select button under the action field to view, modify, clone or delete a contact.
Clicking the name of the contact will display additional details about the contact.
Add a contact using the link "Add a Contact" at the top of the page

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: Data can be filtered, exported and displayed in different formats. This also shows the number of times an exported data has been downloaded.

features.featureDescription: You can also choose to display the list of all the exported data in the system or the exported data created by you.
The exported data can be viewed as a .csv file or in html format. The exported data can also be deleted when the select button in the action field is clicked.
New export data can be generated, which lets you choose from the contacts list.

pageDescription.title: Contact Details
pageDescription.description: The details about the contact are displayed here along with the record information containing the owner, the employee who entered the details and finally the person who last modified these details.

features.featureDescription: You can modify, clone, or delete the details of the contact.

pageDescription.title: Message Details
pageDescription.description: This page lists all the messages associated with the contact, showing the name of the message, its date and its status.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the name of the message displays more details about the message.
You can view the messages in two different views, i.e. all the messages present or the messages created/assigned by you.

pageDescription.title: Forwarding a call
pageDescription.description: The details of the calls that are associated with a contact can be forwarded to different employees present in the system.

features.featureDescription: You can select the list of the recipients to whom you want to forward the particular call to by using the "Add Recipients" link.

pageDescription.title: List of recipients
pageDescription.description: This page shows the list of recipients to whom the call details that are associated with a contact have been forwarded.

pageDescription.title: Modifying the component details
pageDescription.description: The details of the component associated with an opportunity can be modified.

features.featureDescription: The component type can be selected using the "select" link.
You can assign the component to any user using the dropdown list provided.

pageDescription.title: Modify the opportunity
pageDescription.description: The description of the opportunity can be renamed / updated.

features.featureDescription: You can update or cancel the information changed using the "update" or "cancel" button.

pageDescription.title: List of Folder Records
pageDescription.description: Each contact can have several folders, and each folder further can have multiple records. You can add a record to a folder. Each record present in the folder displays the record name, when it was entered, who modified this record last and when.

features.featureDescription: The folders can be selected using the drop down list.
You can click on the record name, to view the folder record details.
You can view the details and modify them by clicking the select button under the action column.
You can add a new record to a folder using the "Add a record to this folder" link.
The folders can be selected using the drop down list.

pageDescription.title: Modify Folder Record
pageDescription.description: Here you can modify the details of the folder record.

features.featureDescription: The changes made in the details of the folders can be updated or canceled using the "Update" or "Cancel" button.

pageDescription.title: Opportunity Details
pageDescription.description: All the opportunities associated with the contact are shown here, with its best possible total and the when the opportunity was last modified. You can filter the different types of opportunities that can be selected using the drop down and display them.

features.featureDescription: You can also click the select button under the action column for viewing, modifying and deleting an opportunity.
Clicking on the name of the opportunity will display the details of the opportunity.
Choosing the different types of opportunities from the drop down filters the display.
Add an opportunity associated with a contact.

pageDescription.description: Enables you to select contacts from a list and then add them to the Action List. It shows the name of the contact along with his email and type of contact.

features.featureDescription: You can filter the contact list in three different views. The views are all contacts, your contacts and Account contacts.
Check any or all the contacts from the list you want to assign to your action List.

pageDescription.title: Contact detail page
pageDescription.description: The contact details associated with the account are displayed here. The details such as the account number, email address, phone number and the addresses are shown.

features.featureDescription: You can also view, modify, clone or delete the contact by clicking the corresponding button.
You can associate calls, messages and opportunities with each of the contacts already in the system.

pageDescription.title: List of Messages
pageDescription.description: The list of messages related to the contacts.

features.featureDescription: You can view all the messages related to the contact or only the messages owned by you. (My messages)

pageDescription.description: Adding/Modifying a new contact

features.featureDescription: This is for adding or updating a new detailed employee record into the system. The last name is the only mandatory field in creating an employee record, However it is important to add as much information as you can.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: If a contact already exists in the system, you can search for that contact by name, company, title, contact type or source, by typing the search term in the appropriate field, and clicking the Search button.

features.featureDescription: If the contact already exists in the system, you can search for that contact by name, company, title, contact type or source, by typing the search term in the appropriate field, and clicking the Search button.
You can filter, export, and display data in different formats by clicking the Export link at the top of the page.
Click Add to add a new contact into the application.
You may also import your existing contacts from microsoft outlook( or comparable cvs format) into the application.

pageDescription.title: Add Import
pageDescription.description:
This page allows you to upload a cvs file and import contacts from the uploaded file. Once uploaded, the import is tagged as "Import Pending."
Once the file is uploaded, the import process can be started off by mapping the contents (the columns) of the file to the the fields of the application.

pageDescription.title: Process Import
pageDescription.description:
This page displays the first five records of the cvs file, and then maps known columns to the fields of the application. It allows you to cusomize your import by allowing you to map the columns of the cvs file to the fields of the application.
If the uploaded file is erroneous in its content (not in cvs format, or if the number of headings and columns do not match), you are not allowed to process the import until the errors are corrected.

features.featureDescription: This page is four sections.
The 'Import Properties" section displays the file that was imported and the Name provided to identify the import.
The next section displays the heading of the import file and four records following it.
The "general errors/warnings" section displays errors in the CVS file.
The "Field Mappings" section lists all the columns in the file based on the heading and maps known columns in the file to the fields in the application.

Against each listed column heading in the field mappings section is a drop list that displays the list of fields that exist to store contact information in the CRM application. Using this drop list you may modify automatically identified field mappings and map those that the application failed to automatically identify.

rules.ruleDescription: Apart from email addresses, you may not map more than one column of the cvs file to the same field of the application. An attempt to do so, displays error messages against the rows for which such a mapping was specified.

pageDescription.title: Contact Imports
pageDescription.description: This page lists contact imports and their status. An import may either be unprocessed, queued for processing, running, awaiting approval or approved.

features.featureDescription: An import goes though various stages before finally being approved and locked.
The first stage of an import is the unprocessed stage. In this stage, an import file in cvs format is uploaded to the application. In this stage the import is tagged as 'Import Pending.'

In the second stage, the unprocessed contacts file that was uploaded is queued to be processed. To do so, you need to map the various columns in the cvs file to the relevant contact fields(names, emails, telephones, etc) in the application. When the columns are mapped, the import is queued to be processed. Only one import is processed at a time, hence subsequent imports are queued until all previous imports are processed.

When an import is being processed (or running) the CRM application reads the cvs file, and creates contacts in the application. After the entire file is processed, the contacts are tagged as 'Pending approval'.

When the contacts are tagged as "Pending approval", you may examine whether the import worked as it was expected, and decide whether the imported contacts can be used for the due course of business. If you find that the mappings you specified were erroneous or insufficient, you may delete the import (which also deletes all contacts of the import) and create another one.

During the import process, some records in the cvs file may fail to import to the application. The failure is usually due to an incorrect specification of phone number, or very large names, etc. Such failed records are copied to an "error file" and available for you to examine. You may correct the information in the error file and run an import for this file alone, or you may add the records to the application manually.
When an import is approved, the contacts of this import are visible in the contacts list view and these contacts are ready to be used in the application.
When a import is approved, its results can only be viewed. The contacts of an approved import cannot be deleted en mass.

module.name: Pipeline
module.briefDescription: Pipeline helps in creating opportunities or leads in the company. Each opportunity helps to follow-up on a lead, which might eventually turn into a client. Here you can create an opportunity, search for an existing opportunity in the system, or export the data in different formats. The dashboard displays a progress chart in different views for all the employees working under the hierarchy of the owner of the opportunity.
module.detailDescription:
This Pipeline System has four main features:
Dashboard: Gives you a quick, visual overview of opportunities.
Add: This page lets you add an opportunity into the system. Here a new opportunity can be added by giving the description of the opportunity. You can add a component that is associated with the opportunity. Each component can be assigned to an employee and the type of the component can be selected. For each component the probability of closing the component, the date estimated, the best guess for closing the deal and the duration for that component can be entered.
Search: You can search for an opportunity already existing in the system based on different filters.
Export: The data can be filtered, exported and displayed in different formats.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: The progress chart is displayed in different views for all the employees working under the owner or creator of the opportunity. The opportunities are shown, with their names and the probable gross revenue associated with that opportunity. Finally the list of employees reporting to a particular employee/supervisor is also shown below the progress chart

features.featureDescription: You can view the progress chart in different views for all the employees working under the owner or creator of the opportunity. The views can be selected from the drop down box present under the chart. The mouse over or a click on the break point on the progress chart will give the date and exact value associated with that point.
The opportunities created are also shown, with their names and the probable gross revenue associated with that opportunity. Clicking on the opportunities shows a details page for the opportunity.

The list of employees reporting to a particular employee/supervisor is also shown below the progress chart. Clicking on an employee shows the Opportunity page from that person's point of view. You can then work your way back up the chain by clicking the Up One Level link.

pageDescription.title: Add a Opportunity
pageDescription.description:
This page lets you add a opportunity into the system.
Here a new opportunity can be added by giving a description of the opportunity, then adding a component that is associated with the opportunity. An opportunity can have one or more components. Each component can be assigned to a different employee and the type of the component can be selected. For each component the probability of closing the component, the date estimated, the best guess for closing the deal and the duration for that component are required.

features.featureDescription: The probability of Close, Estimated Close Date, Best Guess Estimate (what will the gross revenue be for this component?), and Estimated Term (over what time period?), are mandatory fields.
You can assign the component to yourself or one of the users in your hierarchy.
The Component Description is a mandatory field. Be descriptive as you will be using this to search on later.
Use the Save button to save your changes and exit, Cancel to cancel your changes and exit, and Reset to cancel your changes and start over.
Enter an Alert Description and Date to remind yourself to follow up on this component at a later date.
You must associate the component with either a Contact or an Account. Choose one of the radio buttons, then one of the Select links.

pageDescription.title: Search Opportunities
pageDescription.description: You can search for an existing opportunity based on different filters.

features.featureDescription: Existing opportunities can be searched using this feature. Opportunities can be searched on description, account name, or contact name with whom the opportunity is associated. It can also be searched by current progress / stage of the opportunity or the closing date range.

pageDescription.title: Export Data
pageDescription.description: Pipeline data can be exported, filtered, and displayed in different formats. You can also view the data online in html format, and see number of times the exported data has been downloaded.

features.featureDescription: The exported data can be viewed or downloaded as a .csv file or in html format. The exported data can also be deleted when the select button in the action column is clicked.
You can also choose to display the list of all the exported data in the system or the exported data created by you.
New export data can be generated by choosing from the contacts list.

pageDescription.title: Modify Component
pageDescription.description: You can modify the component details associated with an opportunity in a pipeline.

features.featureDescription: Component Description is a mandatory field
Use Update at the top or bottom to save your changes, Cancel to quit this page without saving, and Reset to reset all fields to default and start over.
Add an Alert Description and Date to alert you via a CRM System Message to take a new action

Probability of close, Estimated Close Date (when you will get the revenue), Best Guess Estimate (how much revenue you will get), and Estimated Term (what term the revenue will be realized over) are all the mandatory fields.
You can select a Component Type from the dropdown. These component types are configurable by your System Administrator.
You can assign the component to any User using the dropdown list present.

pageDescription.title: Adding a call
pageDescription.description: You can add a new call here associated with the opportunity.

features.featureDescription: The type of the call can be a phone, fax or in person. Some notes regarding the call can be noted. You can add an alert to remind you to follow up on this call.
The Contact dropdown is automatically populated with the correct contacts for the company or account you are dealing with.

pageDescription.title: Modify the opportunity:
pageDescription.description: The description of the opportunity can be modified / updated.

features.featureDescription: You can update or cancel the information changed using the "update" or "cancel" button present.

pageDescription.title: Modify Document
pageDescription.description: Modify the Subject or filename of a document.

features.featureDescription: You can update the details of the documents using the update button.

pageDescription.title: Component Details
pageDescription.description: The component details for the opportunity are shown here.

features.featureDescription: The component details are shown with additional options for modifying and deleting the component.

pageDescription.title: Upload a new version of document
pageDescription.description: You can upload a new version of the document and the new version of the file can be selected and uploaded.

features.featureDescription: The document can be uploaded using the upload button.
The new version of the document can be selected from your local computer using the browse button.

pageDescription.title: List of components
pageDescription.description: The components resulted from the search are shown here. Different views of the components and its types are displayed. The name of the component with the estimated amount of money associated with the opportunity and the probability of that components being a success is shown. This also displays the time for closing the deal (term) and the organization name or the contact name if they are associated with the opportunity. A new opportunity can also be added.

features.featureDescription: For each of the component you can view the details, modify the content or delete it completely using the select button in the Action column.
You can add an opportunity here by giving complete details about the opportunity.
The search results for existing opportunities are displayed here.
There are different views of the opportunities you can choose from the drop down list and the corresponding types for the opportunities.

pageDescription.title: Opportunity Details
pageDescription.description: You can view all the details about the components here and also add a new component to a particular opportunity. Calls and the documents can be associated with the opportunity

features.featureDescription: In the Documents tab, documents associated with an opportunity can be added. This also displays the documents already linked with this opportunity and other details about the document. Details can be viewed, downloaded, modified or deleted by using the select button in the action column

In the Calls tab you can add a call associated with the opportunity. This also displays the calls already linked with this opportunity and other details about the call. The call details can be viewed, modified, forwarded or deleted by using the select button in the action column.
You can rename or delete the opportunity itself using the buttons below.
You can modify, view and delete the details of any particular component by clicking the select button in the action column.
In the Components tab, you can add a component. It also displays the status, amount and the date when the component will be closed.
There are three tabs in each opportunity i.e. components, calls and documents.
You get the organization name or the contact name at the top, which on clicking will take you to the Account details.

pageDescription.title: Forwarding a call
pageDescription.description: The details of calls associated with a contact can be forwarded to different users present in the system.

features.featureDescription: You can select the list of the recipients to whom you want to forward a call to by using the "Add Recipients" link. This will bring up a window with all users, from which you can then choose using check boxes.
You can email a copy of the call to a user's Internet email by checking the Email check box.
You can add to the message by simply typing in the Body text box.

pageDescription.title: Document Details
pageDescription.description: In the Documents tab, the documents associated with a particular opportunity can be added to, and viewed.

features.featureDescription: The version of the particular document can be modified using the add version link.
A document can be viewed, downloaded, modified or deleted by using the select button in the action column.
A click on the subject of the document will show all the versions present.

pageDescription.title: Modify call details
pageDescription.description: You can modify the details of the calls.

features.featureDescription: The type of the call can be selected using the drop down list and all the other details related to the call are updated using the update button

pageDescription.title: Opportunity Details
pageDescription.description: You can view all the details about an opportunity components here and also add a new component to a particular opportunity. Calls and documents can also be added to an opportunity or viewed by clicking on the appropriate tab.

features.featureDescription: In the Calls tab you can add a call to the opportunity. This also displays the calls already linked with this opportunity and other details about the call. The call details can be viewed, modified, forwarded or deleted by using the select button in the action column
In the Components tab, you can add a component. It also displays the status, amount and the date when the component will be closed.
There are three tabs in each opportunity i.e. components, calls and documents.
You can rename or delete the whole opportunity (not just one of these components) using the buttons at the bottom.
The organization or contact name appears on top, above the Components Tab, which when clicked, will take you to the Account details.
You can modify, view and delete the details of any component by clicking the select button in the Action column, on the far left.

In the Documents tab, documents associated with the particular opportunity can be added. This also displays the documents already linked with this opportunity and other details about the document. Details can be viewed, downloaded, modified or deleted by using the select button in the action column

pageDescription.title: Call Details
pageDescription.description: Calls associated with the opportunity are shown. Calls can be added to the opportunity, and details about listed calls can be examined.

features.featureDescription: In the Calls tab you can add a call associated with the opportunity. This also displays the calls already linked with this opportunity and other details about the call. The call details can be viewed, modified, forwarded or deleted by using the select button in the action column
If the call subject is clicked then complete details about the call are displayed.

pageDescription.description: The opportunities resulted from the search are shown here. Different views of the opportunities and its types are displayed. The name of the component with the estimated amount of money associated with the opportunity and the probability of that opportunity being a success are shown. This also displays the time for closing the deal (term) and the organization name or the contact name if they are associated with the opportunity.

features.featureDescription: There are different views of the opportunities you can choose from the dropdown list and the corresponding types of the opportunities.
You can add an opportunity here by giving complete details about the opportunity.
The search results for existing opportunities are displayed here.

For each of the components you can view the details, modify the content or delete it completely using the select button in the Action column. You can click on any of the component names, which shows more details about the component, such as the calls and documents associated with it.

pageDescription.description: Pipeline helps in creating prospective opportunities or leads in the company. Each opportunity helps to follow up a lead, who might eventually turn into a client. Here you can create an opportunity, search for an existing opportunity in the system, export the data to different formats. The dashboard reflects the progress chart in different views for all the employees working under the owner/creator of the opportunity.

features.featureDescription: The list of employees reporting to a particular employee/supervisor is also shown below the progress chart.
Opportunities are displayed, with name and probable revemue. Clicking on the opportunities displays more details of the opportunity.

You can view the progress chart in different views for all the employees working under the owner or creator of the opportunity. The views can be selected from the drop down box under the chart. The mouse over or a click on the break point on the progress chart will give the date and exact value associated with that point.

pageDescription.title: Component Details
pageDescription.description: The component details for the opportunity are shown here.

features.featureDescription: The component details are shown with additional options for modifying and deleting the component.

pageDescription.description: The calls associated with the opportunity are shown. Calls can be added to the opportunity.

features.featureDescription: In the Calls tab you can add a call associated with the opportunity. This also displays the calls already linked with this opportunity and other details about the call. Call details can be viewed, modified, forwarded or deleted by using the select button in the action column.
If the call subject is clicked then it will display complete details about the call.

pageDescription.title: Call Details
pageDescription.description: Details about the call associated with the opportunity

features.featureDescription: You can modify, delete and forward each of the calls.

pageDescription.title: Upload a document
pageDescription.description: New documents related to the opportunity can be uploaded into the system.

features.featureDescription: Clicking the Upload button will upload the selected document into the system.

Clicking the Browse button opens a file browser on your own system. Simply navigate to the file on your drive that you want to upload and click Open. This will close the window and bring you back to the upload page.
Add a very descriptive Subject for the file. This is a mandatory field.

pageDescription.title: Document Details
pageDescription.description: This shows all versions of the updated document. The name of the file with it's size, version and the number of downloads are shown here.

features.featureDescription: All the versions of the document can be downloaded from here. Simply select the version you want and click the Download link on the far left.

pageDescription.title: List of exported data
pageDescription.description: The data present can be used to export data and display that in different formats. The exported data can be filtered in different ways. This would also let you view the data download it. This also shows the number of times an exported data has been downloaded

features.featureDescription: The exported data can be viewed as a .csv file or in the html format. The exported data can also be deleted when the select button in the action field is clicked.
You can also choose to display the list of all the exported data in the system or the exported data created by you.
New export data can be generated, which lets you choose from the contacts list.
Click on the subject of the new export, the data is displayed in html format

pageDescription.title: Generating Export data
pageDescription.description: Generate an exported report from pipeline data

features.featureDescription: Click the Generate button at top or bottom to generate the report from the fields you have included. Click cancel to quit and go back to the Export Data page.
Highlight the fields you want to include in the left column and click the Add or All link. Highlight fields in the right column and click the Del link to remove them.
Use the Sorting dropdown to sort the report by one of a variety of fields
Use the Criteria dropdown to use opportunities from My or All Opportunities
The Subject is a mandatory field.

module.name: Accounts
module.briefDescription: You are looking at the Accounts module homepage, which has a dashboard view of all your accounts. This view is based on a date range selected from the calendar; by default it shows the schedule for the next seven days. You can optionally view the calendar of those below you in your hierarchy. The scheduled actions of each user can also be viewed. In the Accounts Module, new accounts can be added, existing accounts can be searched based on different filters, revenue for each account can be created/maintained and finally, data can be exported to different formats.
module.detailDescription:
The Accounts module has five main features.
Dashboard: Displays a dashboard view account contract expirations.
Add: Allows you to add a new account
Search: This page provides a search feature for the accounts present in the system
Revenue: Graphically visualizes revenue if the historical data is present in the system. All the accounts with revenue are shown along with a list of employees working under you under the progress chart. You can add accounts, search for the existing ones in the system based on different filters and export the data to different formats
Export: Data can be exported and displayed in different formats. The exported data can be filtered in different ways. You can view the data, download it, and see the number of times an exported report has been downloaded

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: The date range can be modified which is shown in the right hand window by clicking on a specific date on the calendar. Accounts with contract end dates or other required actions appear in the right hand window reminding the user to take action on them. The schedule, actions, alert dates and contract end dates are displayed for user or the employees under him by using the dropdown at the top of the page. Clicking on the alert link will let the user modify the details of the account owner.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the alert link will let you modify the details of the account owner.
Accounts with contract end dates or other required actions will appear in the right hand window where you can take action on them.
You can view the schedule, actions, alert dates and contract end dates for yourself or your employees by using the dropdown at the top of the page.

You can modify the date range shown in the right hand window by clicking on a specific date on the calendar, or on one of the arrows to the left of each week on the calendar to give you a week's view. Clicking on "Back To Next 7 Days View" at the top of the right window changes the view to the next seven days. The day or week you are currently viewing is highlighted in yellow. Today's date is highlighted in blue. You can change the month and year using the dropdowns at the top of the calendar, and you can always return to today by using the Today link, also at the top of the calendar.

pageDescription.title: Add an Account
pageDescription.description: A new account can be added here

features.featureDescription: Use the Insert button at top or bottom to save your changes, Cancel to quit without saving, and Reset to reset all the fields to their default values and start over.

It's a faily straightforward "fill in the blanks" exercise. There should be a "Primary" or "Business", or "Main" version of phone/fax numbers and addresses because other modules such as Communications Manager use these to perform other actions.
Fill in as many fields as possible. Most of them can be used later as search terms and for queries in reports.
Depending on whether you have chosen Organization or Individual, there are mandatory description fields to fill out about the account.
Choose whether this account is an Organization or an Individual with the appropriate radio button.

Clicking the Select link next to Account Type(s) will open a window with a variety of choices for Account Types. You cah choose and number by clicking the checkboxes to the left. It is important to use this feature as your choice(s) are used for searches and as the subject of querries in reports in other parts of the application.

pageDescription.title: Modify Account
pageDescription.description: The details of an account can be modified here

features.featureDescription: The account owner can also be changed using the drop down list
The account type can be selected using the "Select" button

This is for adding or updating account details. The last name or the organization name, based on the classification, is the only mandatory field in creating a new account. The type of account can be selected using the select option given next to the account type

If the Account has a contract, you should enter a contract end date in the fields provided. This will generate an icon on the Home Page and an alert for the owner of the account that action must be taken at a prearranged time.

pageDescription.title: Contact Details
pageDescription.description: A contact can be associated with an account. The lists of the contacts associated with the account are shown along with the title.

features.featureDescription: You can also view, modify, clone and delete the contact by clicking the select button under the action column.
When the name of the contact is clicked, it shows details of that contact, with the options to modify, clone and delete the contact details.
You can add a contact, which is associated with the account.

pageDescription.title: Folder Record Details
pageDescription.description: You create folders for accounts. Each folder can have one or more records associated with it, depending on the type of the folder. The details about records associated with the folder are shown

features.featureDescription: Using the select button in the action column you can view details and modify the record.
You can click on the record type to view the folders details and modify them.
A new record can be added to the folder.
The folders can be populated by configuring the module in the admin tab.. The type of the folder can be changed using the drop down list shown.

pageDescription.description: Opportunities associated with the contact, showing the best guess total and last modified date.

pageDescription.title: Modify Opportunity
pageDescription.description: The details of the opportunity can be modified

features.featureDescription: The description of the opportunity can be changed using the update button.

pageDescription.title: Component Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the details about the opportunity like what is the probability of closing the opportunity, what is the current stage of the opportunity etc

features.featureDescription: You can modify and delete the opportunity created using the modify and the delete buttons

pageDescription.title: Add a component
pageDescription.description: A component can be added to an opportunity and assigned to any employee present in the system. The component type can also be selected.

features.featureDescription: The component type can be selected using the “select ” link
You can assign the component to any of the employee present using the dropdown list present.

pageDescription.title: Modify Component
pageDescription.description: The details of the component can be added / updated to an opportunity and assigned to any employee present in the system. The component type can also be selected.

features.featureDescription: The component type can be selected using the “select ” link
You can assign the component to any of the employee present using the dropdown list present.
Clicking the update button can save the changes made to the component

pageDescription.title: Component Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the details about the opportunity like what is the probability of closing the opportunity, what is the current stage of the opportunity etc

features.featureDescription: You can modify and delete the opportunity created using the modify and the delete buttons

pageDescription.title: Contracts
pageDescription.description:
This page lists all the service contracts associated with the account. Based on your permissions you would be able to add new service contracts and modify exting ones from this page.
A service contract describes the terms and conditions in a contract including the start and end dates, the contract value, the number of hours, service models and other details.

pageDescription.title: Add Contract
pageDescription.description:
This page allows you to add a service contract to the account.
A service contract describes the terms and conditions in a contract including the start and end dates, the contract value, the number of hours, service models and other details.

features.featureDescription: This page is contains a general information section, a block hour information section and service model options section.

The general information section allows you to enter a service contract number, the start and end dates, the contract value, category, type, labor categories and free form description and billing notes.

The category and type of for service contacts are configured by your administrator to suit your business requirements. If you find, that a category or type required to describe the contract is not available in the list, please contract your manager of administrator to add the options. The options can be added using the administrator view.

The block hour information allows you to specify or adjust the hours associated with the contract. The adjust link opens a pop up that allows you to enter hours credited or hours subtracted (preced with a '-' for negative numbers) a description and choose from a pre-configured list, the reason for the change. Again, if you do not find the required reason, please contact your manager or administrator to add the new option.
When your company performs work as a result of requests to the help desk department, the hours remaining is modified based on the travel and labor hours counted towards this contract.

The service model options allow you to specify the terms of the service contract for various types of services (telephone, onsite, email or a general response time.) All the service model options are mandatory. If one of the service model options is not relevant to the account, it is required to explicitly choose the option that specifies that this option is not not applicable. Hence, it is recommended that each of these lists be pre-configured with at least the "not applicable" option.

The select link in the labor categories field, allows multiple labor categories to be assigned to this service contract. The select link opens a pop up that displays labor category codes and a description of these codes. These labor category records were either setup during initial system installation or through the products module of this CRM application. If you require a labor category that is not available in the list view of the popup, you may add one using the catalog module if you have permission to add them, or contact your manager or administrator who has permissions to add labor categories using the catalog module.

rules.ruleDescription: The current end date should be greater than the current contract date if the current contract date is specified. If current contract date is not specified, the current end date should be greater than the initial contract date.
The current contract date is not required. If it is left blank, it is prefilled with the initial contract date when this contract record is saved.

pageDescription.title: Modify Contract
pageDescription.description:
This page allows your to modify contract information.
A service contract describes the terms and conditions in a contract including the start and end dates, the contract value, the number of hours, service models and other details.

features.featureDescription: This page is contains a general information section, a block hour information section and service model options section.
The functionality and business rule for the general information section and the service model options section are similar to those of "add contract".

The block hour information section allows you adjust the hours for this contract. The adjust link is similar to that in the "add contract" page and allows you to either reimburse or subtract (precede with a '-') the hours for this contract. The new hours as a result of the adjustment is displayed when the pop up closes and is saved only when the service contract is updated.

pageDescription.title: Service Contract Details
pageDescription.description: This page displays the information of a service contract. The information is divided into general information, block hour information and service model options

features.featureDescription: A history link is visible if hours where specified for this contract or when as a result of work orders to the help desk department, hours were counted towards this contract.

The history link opens a popup that shows a list of entries that modified the hours. The hours may have been modified(or initially added) when the service contract was created, or as a result of work orders to the help desk department or due to an explicit modification of the service contract details.

The labor categories field displays a list of comma seperated labor category codes specified for this contract. A description of these codes can be viewed from the catalog module of this CRM application.

pageDescription.title: Assets
pageDescription.description: This page displays assets associated with the service contract of the account. Based on your permissions you would be able to add new assets or modify existing ones from this page.

pageDescription.title: Add Asset
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to add an asset to the account and associate it with a service contract

features.featureDescription: The information about an asset is categorized into the specific asset information, asset category, the service contract information, the service options for this asset, the warranty information and financial information. It also allows additional notes to be entered for this asset.
The serial number is mandatory to add an asset. It is usually provided by the manufacturer of the asset.
The date listed is prefilled with the current date and specifies the date when the asset was recorded to be part of the service contract for this account.
The Asset Tag is an internal identifier provided for the asset. The asset tag is usually unique for all assets associated with an account.

The category section allows you to categorize the asset to a fine level of detail (e.g., Hardware - Server - Blade Server). Level 1, Level 2 and Level 3 are drop lists where the contents visible in each level depends upon the item chosen in the preceding level.

The information in the drop lists of the category section are preconfigured in the admin module. If you have to add or modify the categories that need to be displayed, you may do so by configuring the asset module. An administrator or a person with access to the admin module would be able to configure the categories that need to be displayed in the category section of this page.

The service model options section allows you to specify the service model options for an asset. The service model options for an asset are defaulted to the the service model options of the service contract that this asset is associated with. These may be changed by choosing another item from the respective drop lists.

In the service contract section of this page, the select link opens a pop up and displays a list of service contracts associated with the account. Clicking on the add link against a service contract record in the pop up associates the specified service contract with the asset. The association is permanently recorded only when the asset is saved.

rules.ruleDescription: For most assets it is percieved that the puchased date is earler than the expiration date. As the application does not enforce this rule, it is recommended that you verify the entry in these two fields before saving the information about the asset. It is possible for an asset to have an expiration date that is earlier than the purchased date if the asset is a pre-used asset, and its warranty expired during the time it was with the previous owner or if the warranty does not transfer with the transfer of the asset.

pageDescription.title: Asset Details
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to view asset details associated with a service contract of the account.

features.featureDescription: The asset details are categorized into specific asset information, asset category, service contract information, service options for this asset, warranty information and financial information.

The service model options for this asset displays the items chosen when the asset record was created or modified. If they are specified to default to the service options in the service contract, the option is preceded by the word 'Default'.

pageDescription.title: Modify Asset
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to modify an asset associated it with a service contract of this account.

rules.ruleDescription: Similar to the adding an asset

pageDescription.title: Asset History
pageDescription.description: The page displays the maintenance history of the asset. This history for the asset is generated when the help desk department initiates a maintenance for this asset. The asset is maintained based on the service model options specified for the asset.

pageDescription.title: Add Account Contact
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to add an account contact and to permit the account to use the CRM application as a portal user

features.featureDescription: The account contact information consists of the contact's name and contact information (email, telephone and postal addresses.)

The 'select' link of the contact type field open's a popup that allows you to choose the contact types that are applicable for this contact. The contact types are preconfigured in the admin module. If you do not find a contact type that you need, you may edit the types in the admin module or contact your supervisor or an administrator who has permissions to do so.

Checking the box at the end of this page enables you to provide portal access to this account contact. Since portal usage information is sent by email to the account contacts, to complete the process of providing portal access to an account contact, it is mandatory for the account contact to have an email address.

rules.ruleDescription: An account contact may have a number of email addresses, this page allows one email address to be chosen as the primary email address. The primary email address is by default used to email the account contact about portal usage information. However, if the account contact has only one email address, it is not required to choose it as the primary contact.

pageDescription.title: Modify contact
pageDescription.description: The details of an account contact can be modified or updated here.

features.featureDescription: The 'select' link of the contact type field open's a popup that allows you to choose the contact types that are applicable for this contact. The contact types are preconfigured in the admin module. If you do not find a contact type that you need, you may edit the types in the admin module or contact your supervisor or an administrator who has permissions to do so.
The details can be updated using the update button.
The account contact information consists of the contact's name and contact information (email, telephone and postal addresses.)

rules.ruleDescription: An account contact may have a number of email addresses, this page allows one email address to be chosen as the primary email address. The primary email address is by default used to email the account contact about portal usage information. However, if the account contact has only one email address, it is not required to choose it as the primary contact.

pageDescription.title: Contact Portal
pageDescription.description: This page displays the portal information (username, expiration date) of this account contact.

features.featureDescription: Based on your permissions, you can provide portal access to an account contact who does not have portal access, edit the portal user information and disable(or enable) the portal user from this page.
If the account contact does not have an email address, you will not be allowed to add or edit the portal user information for the account contact.

pageDescription.title: Modify Contact Portal
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to modify the portal information of the account contact.

features.featureDescription: The information that is modified in this page affects portal access to the application for the user.
The information than can be modified are, the portal role (if more than one role exists,) the expiration date and the password.

The password is automatically generated and mailed to the account contact, hence, for this purpose it is mandatory for the account contact to have an email address when the portal information is modified.

pageDescription.title: Add Contact Portal
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to allow the account contact access to this appication as a portal user. A portal user is allowed to see account information only for the account to which he is listed as a contact.

features.featureDescription: This page allows you to specify the portall role, the expiration date and the email to which portal access information (username and password) is sent.

The password is automatically generated and mailed to the account contact, hence, for this purpose it is mandatory for the account contact to have an email address when the portal information is modified.

module.name: Communications
module.briefDescription: Communications is a "Campaign Manager" Module where you can manage complex email. fax, or mail communications with your customers. Communications allows you to create and choose Groups, Messages, and Schedules to define communications scenarios from the simple to the very complex. Groups can range from a single contact chosen from a pick list to the result of a complex query of the Account/Contact database. Messages can be anything from a single-line email to a rich, multimedia product catalog to an interactive survey.
module.detailDescription:
The Communication module has six main features.
Dashboard: Track and analyze campaigns that have been activated and executed. Messages can be sent out by any combination of email, fax, or mail merge. The Dashboard shows an overview of sent messages and allows you to drill down and view recipients and any survey results.
Add: This page lets you add a new campaign.
Campaign List: This page lets you add a new campaign into the system.
Groups: Each campaign needs at least one group to send a message to. Use criteria to filter the contacts you need to reach and use them over and over again. As new contacts meet the criteria, they will be included in future campaigns. This page lists the group names. It shows the groups created by you or everybody i.e. all the groups.
Messages: Compose a message to reach your audience. Each campaign requires a message that will be sent to selected groups. Write the message once, then use it in any number of future campaigns. Modified messages will only affect future campaigns. Displays the list of messages, with the description and other details.
Attachments: Customize and configure your Campaigns with attachments. Attachments can include interactive items, like surveys, or provide additional materials like files.

pageDescription.title: Communications Dashboard
pageDescription.description:
Track and analyze campaigns that have been activated and executed.
Messages can be sent out by any combination of email, fax, or mail merge. The Dashboard shows an overview of sent messages and allows you to drill down and view recipients and any survey results.

features.featureDescription: Clicking the select button under the action column gives you the option to view the details about the campaign, download the mail merge and also lets you to export it to Excel.
Clicking on the campaign name gives you complete details about the campaign.
You can display the campaigns created and their details using three different views by selecting from the drop down list.

pageDescription.title: Add a campaign
pageDescription.description: This page lets you add a new campaign into the system.

features.featureDescription: This creates a new Campaign. This takes in both the campaign and its description.

pageDescription.title: Campaign List
pageDescription.description:
Create or work on existing campaigns.
The Campaign Builder allows you to select groups of contacts that you would like to send a message to, as well as schedule a delivery date. Additional options are available.

features.featureDescription: You can view, modify and delete details by clicking the select button under the action column.
For each of the campaign, the groups, message and delivery columns show whether they are complete or not. Clicking on these will help you choose the group, message and the delivery date.
Clicking the name of the campaign shows you more details about the campaign and also shows the list of the things to be selected before a campaign can be activated
You can view your incomplete campaigns or all the incomplete campaigns. You can select the view with the drop down list at the top.
Add a campaign

pageDescription.title: View Groups
pageDescription.description: Each campaign needs at least one group to which to send a message. Use criteria to filter the contacts you need to reach and use them over and over again. As new contacts meet the criteria, they will be automatically included in future campaigns. This page lists the group names. It shows the groups created by you or everybody; i.e. all the groups.

features.featureDescription: You can also click the select button under the Action column for viewing, modifying or deleting the details.
Clicking the group name will show the list of contacts present in the group.
Add a contact group using the link "Add a Contact Group".
