You can filter the list of groups displayed by selecting from the drop down.

pageDescription.title: Add a Group
pageDescription.description: A new contact group can be added. Separate criteria can be specified when creating the group. The criteria can be defined to generate a list. The list to be added can be previewed before saving the group details.

features.featureDescription: You can preview the details of the group by clicking on the preview button.
You can also select from the list of "Selected criteria and contacts" and remove them by clicking the remove button.
You can define the criteria to generate the list by using the different filters present and then add them to the "Selected criteria and contacts".
You can select the criteria for the group to be created. Clicking the "Add/Remove Contacts" can choose the specific contacts.

pageDescription.title: Message List
pageDescription.description: Compose a message to reach your audience. Each campaign requires a message that will be sent to selected groups. Write the message once, then use it in any number of future campaigns. Modified messages will only affect future campaigns. Displays the list of messages, with the description and other details.

features.featureDescription: You can view, modify, clone or delete each of the messages.
The dropdown list acts as filters for displaying the messages that meet certain criteria.
Clicking on the message name will show details about the message, which can be updated.
Add a new message

pageDescription.title: Adding a Message
pageDescription.description: You can add a new message for the campaign, which would show up in the message list.

features.featureDescription: The new message can be saved by clicking the save message button.
The permissions or the access type for the message can be chosen from drop down box.

pageDescription.title: Create Attachments
pageDescription.description: Customize and configure your Campaigns with attachments. Attachments can include interactive items, like surveys, or provide additional materials like files.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the "surveys" will let you create new interactive surveys.

pageDescription.description: Contacts of the group are displayed

features.featureDescription: You can use the preview button to view the details about the contacts in a group.
You can modify or delete a group.

pageDescription.description: version change of a document

features.featureDescription: You can change the version of the document when ever an updated document is uploaded.

pageDescription.description: New documents can be uploaded and be associated with the campaign.

features.featureDescription: You can browse to select a new document to upload if its related to the campaign.

pageDescription.description: Here details about the contacts, i.e. the name, their company, and their email address are displayed.

features.featureDescription: You can also go back from the current detailed view to the group details criteria.

pageDescription.title: Campaign Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the details about the campaign and also shows the list of available documents.

features.featureDescription: You can download from the list of documents available by using the "download" link under the action column.

pageDescription.title: Groups
pageDescription.description: The group name along with the contacts present in the Group are listed

pageDescription.title: Adding a survey
pageDescription.description: You can add a new survey here

features.featureDescription: The name of the survey is a mandatory field for creating a survey. A description, introduction and thank-you note can also be added.

pageDescription.title: Campaign Details
pageDescription.description: Campaign details are the number of groups selected for the campaign, the text message of the campaign, when is it scheduled to run, how the delivery of the message done, who entered these details and who modified it are shown here.

features.featureDescription: You can download the mail merge shown at the bottom of the details.

pageDescription.description: All Versions of this current Document are shown here with the details like the size of the uploaded file, the number of downloads etc.

features.featureDescription: Different versions of the document can be downloaded using the "download" link in the action column.

pageDescription.description: For the campaign you can schedule a delivery date to send the message to the recipients.

features.featureDescription: You can update the campaign schedule by filling in the run date and the delivery method whether it's an email, fax or letter or any other method.

pageDescription.description: Here you can update the group details and also the update contact criteria.

features.featureDescription: You can also generate a list of contacts be selecting from the filters and adding them to the "selected criteria and contacts" list.
You can choose the contacts in the group using the "Add / Remove contacts" link present.
You can update the name of the group

pageDescription.title: List of Recipients
pageDescription.description: The page displays a list of recipients with their name, company name, the date when the campaign was sent to those recipients and its status.

pageDescription.title: Message Details
pageDescription.description: The message details are shown here, in the form of an email with a subject and message.

features.featureDescription: There can be multiple attachments to a single message. The attachment that needs to be downloaded has to be selected first and then downloaded.

pageDescription.title: Campaign Schedule
pageDescription.description: This shows the delivery date and the delivery method or the campaign.

pageDescription.title: Campaign Results
pageDescription.description: This page shows the results of the responses received from all the recipients in the group. This also shows the Last response received.

pageDescription.title: Campaign Response
pageDescription.description: This page shows the responses of all the recipients along with their system IP addresses and their email address

pageDescription.title: Campaign Document details
pageDescription.description: This page lists all the documents associated with this campaign and for each document it lists the size of the file, the extension and the version of the file.

features.featureDescription: The details of the documents can be viewed or modified by clicking on the select button under the Action column.
You can view the details, modify, download or delete the documents associated with the account.
A new document can be added to the account.
The document versions can be updated by using the "add version" link.

pageDescription.title: Campaign Details
pageDescription.description:
This is the detail page for the campaign, where step-by-step information is given on how to activate the campaign; i.e. what should be selected before a campaign is activated.
This campaign can be configured and can now be activated. Once activated, today's campaigns will begin processing in under 5 minutes and cannot be cancelled.

features.featureDescription: The name of the campaign can be changed or deleted by using the buttons at the bottom of the page.
You can choose a group / groups, a message for the campaign, and a delivery date for the campaign to start. You can also add attachments to the messages you send to recipients.

pageDescription.title: Choose Groups
pageDescription.description: Selecting or updating the group / groups for the campaign can be done here.

features.featureDescription: You can check the groups you want for the current campaign.
You can also add attachments to the messages you send to recipients by clicking the preview recipient's link next to each group.
You can view all the groups present or the groups created by you just by choosing from the drop down box.

pageDescription.title: Message Details
pageDescription.description: Updating a message for the campaign

features.featureDescription: You can select a message for this campaign from the dropdown list of all the messages or just your messages.
The messages can be of multiple types, which can be used as filters and can be selected from the drop down list. For each type you have further classification.

pageDescription.title: Attachment Details
pageDescription.description: For each message, we can add the attachments.

features.featureDescription: The attachments configured are the surveys or the file attachments. Using the links "change survey" and "change file attachments", you can change either of them.

pageDescription.title: Surveys
pageDescription.description: A survey can be selected for this campaign.

features.featureDescription: You can view and select from all, or only your own surveys.

pageDescription.title: File Attachments
pageDescription.description: Campaign can also have a file as an attachment

features.featureDescription: You can download or remove the file name. You can also upload files using the browse button.

pageDescription.title: Modify Campaign Details
pageDescription.description: Updating the campaign name /description

features.featureDescription: The name and the description of the campaign can be changed.

pageDescription.title: Message Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the details of the message.

features.featureDescription: You can modify, delete or clone the message details by clicking on corresponding buttons.

pageDescription.title: Modify Message
pageDescription.description: This page lets you Add/Update a new message. The message can have an access type, limiting who can view a message.

features.featureDescription: You can select font properties for the text of the message along with the size and indentation.
The name of the message and the access type can be given, which specifies who can view the message.

pageDescription.title: Message Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows the details of the message.

features.featureDescription: You can modify, delete or clone the message details by clicking on corresponding buttons.

pageDescription.title: Adding a Message
pageDescription.description: This page lets you Add a new message or Update an existing one. The message can have an access type, defining who can view it.

features.featureDescription: You can select font properties for the text of the message along with the size and indentation.
The name of the message and the access type can be given, which specifies who can view the message.

pageDescription.title: List of Surveys
pageDescription.description: This page displays the surveys created and lets you update them.

features.featureDescription: You can also view, modify and delete the details of a survey.
Clicking on the name of the survey shows its details.
Add a new survey
You can view all or your own surveys using the drop down list.

pageDescription.title: Survey Questions
pageDescription.description: Here you can add a new survey question. If the question type is "Item List", you can edit the list of items present in that list and also mark whether the particular question is required or not.

features.featureDescription: The "Save & Add" button saves the current question and lets you add another one immediately.
You can also specify whether the particular question is required or not by checking the checkbox.
If the selected question type is "Item List", then an Edit button is enabled which helps in adding new elements to the existing list.
A new question type can be selected through the drop down list.

pageDescription.title: Survey Details
pageDescription.description: The details about the survey are displayed here along with the option to modify, delete and preview the survey.

features.featureDescription: The preview button shows you the survey questions in a pop-up window.
You can modify, delete, and preview the survey details using the buttons at the top of the page.
You can view the survey introduction text, the questions and the thank-you text.

pageDescription.title: Survey Details
pageDescription.description: This page displays all the questions added to a particular survey. It also enables you to add new questions. The order of the questions can be changed by moving questions up or down in the list. Questions can also be edited or deleted.

features.featureDescription: You can add questions to the survey here.
Clicking the "Done" button can save the survey and you can also traverse back by clicking the "Back" button.
The survey questions can be moved up or down using the "Up" or "Down" links present in the action field.
You can edit or delete any of the survey questions using the "edit" or "del" link under the action field.
You can add new survey questions here.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: You are looking at the communications module. This page reviews and manages campaigns with the following options: Dashboard, Campaign Builder, Build groups, Create messages and create attachments.

features.featureDescription: You can click on "Create Attachments" and include interactive items, like surveys, or provide additional materials like files.
Clicking the "Create Message" link lets you compose a message to reach your audience.
You can click the "Build Groups" link to assemble dynamic distribution of groups. Each campaign needs at least one group to send a message to.
The "Campaign Builder" can be clicked to select groups of contacts that you would like to send a message to, schedule a delivery date, etc.
You can click on the "Dashboard" to view the sent messages and to drill down and view recipients and survey results.

module.name: Help Desk
module.briefDescription: You are looking at the Help Desk module home page. The dashboard shows the most recent tickets that have been assigned to you, as well as tickets that are in your department, and tickets that have been created by you. You can add new tickets, search for existing tickets based on different filters and export ticket data.
module.detailDescription:
The Help Desk module has four main features.
View: Lists all the tickets assigned to you and the tickets assigned in your department. Details such as the ticket number, priority, age, i.e. how old the ticket is, the company and the tickets assignment are displayed.
Add: You can add a new ticket here.
Search: Form used for searching the tickets that already exist in the system based on different filters and parameters.
Export: This page shows exported data. The data can be exported to different formats. The exported data can be viewed with its subject, the size of the exported data file, when it was created and by whom. It also shows the number of times that particular exported file was downloaded. The exported data, created by you or all the employees can be viewed in two different views. A new data file can also be exported.

pageDescription.title: Ticket Details
pageDescription.description: This page lets you view the details of the ticket also lets you modify or delete the ticket.

features.featureDescription: Lets you modify or delete ticket information
You can also store tasks and documents related to a ticket.

pageDescription.title: Add a Ticket
pageDescription.description: You can add a new ticket here

features.featureDescription: For each new ticket you can select the organization, the contact and also the issue for which the ticket is being created. The assignment and the resolution of the ticket can also be entered.

pageDescription.title: Search Existing Tickets
pageDescription.description: Form used for searching existing tickets based on different filters and parameters.

features.featureDescription: The search can be done based on different parameters like the ticket number, account associated, priority, employee whom the ticket is assigned etc.

pageDescription.title: Export Data
pageDescription.description: This is the page shows exported data. The data can be exported in different formats. The exported data can be viewed with its subject, the size of the exported data file, when it was created and by whom. It also shows the number of times that particular exported file was downloaded. A new data file can also be exported.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the subject of the exported data shows you the details of the ticket like the ticket ID, the organization and its issue (why the particular ticket was generated).
Clicking on the select button under the action column lets you view the data, download the data in .CSV format or delete the data.
You can filter the exported date generated, by you or by all employees using the dropdown list.
You can generate a new exported data by clicking the link "Generate new export".

pageDescription.title: Modify Ticket
pageDescription.description: Here you can modify ticket details like information, classification, assignment and resolution.

features.featureDescription: You can save the details of the modified ticket by clicking the "Update" button.

pageDescription.title: Modify Ticket Details
pageDescription.description: Here you can modify the ticket details like ticket information, it's classification, the ticket’s assignment and it's resolution.

features.featureDescription: You can save the details of the modified ticket by clicking the "Update" button.

pageDescription.title: List of Tasks
pageDescription.description: This page lists the tasks assigned for a particular ticket. New tasks can be added, which would then appear in the list of tasks, showing their priority, their assignment and other details.

features.featureDescription: The details of the task can be viewed or modified by clicking on the select button under the Action column.
You can update the task by clicking on the description of the task.
You can add a task which is associated with the existing ticket.

pageDescription.title: List of Documents
pageDescription.description: Here the documents associated with a ticket are listed. New documents related to the ticket can be added.

features.featureDescription: The details of the documents can be viewed or modified by clicking on the select button under the Action column.
You can view the details, modify, download or delete the documents associated with the ticket.
A new document associated with the ticket can be added.
The document versions can be updated by using the "add version" link.

pageDescription.title: List of Folder Records
pageDescription.description: New folders can be created for each ticket. New Folders are defined and configured in the Admin Module. This page also displays a list of records with their details such as when the record was created, last modified, the action performed on the record etc.

features.featureDescription: A new record is added into the folder using the link "Add a record to this folder". Multiple records can be added to this folder if the folder has the necessary settings.
You can select the custom folder using the drop down list.

pageDescription.title: Add Folder Record
pageDescription.description: The details of the record are added

features.featureDescription: The details are saved by clicking the save button.

pageDescription.title: Ticket Log History
pageDescription.description: The log history of the ticket is maintained.

features.featureDescription: A chronological history of all actions associated with a ticket is maintined.

pageDescription.title: Modify Folder Record
pageDescription.description: This lists the details of the folder record, which can be modified.

features.featureDescription: The changes can be saved using the "Update" button.

pageDescription.title: Folder Record Details
pageDescription.description: The details about the folder along with the record information such as when the record was created and when it was modified is displayed here.

features.featureDescription: You can modify the folder information along with the record details by clicking on the Modify button.

pageDescription.title: Adding a Document
pageDescription.description: A new document related to a ticket can be uploaded.

features.featureDescription: The document can be uploaded using the browse button.

pageDescription.title: Document Details
pageDescription.description: This page shows all the versions of the current document.

features.featureDescription: You can download all the versions of a document.

pageDescription.title: Modify Document Details
pageDescription.description: This page lets you modify the ticket information and update the details.

features.featureDescription: You can also have tasks and documents related to a ticket.
Lets you modify / update the ticket information.

pageDescription.title: Add version number to Documents
pageDescription.description: You can upload a new version of an existing document.

features.featureDescription: A new version of a file can be uploaded using the browse button.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: This page displays the complete list of the tickets assigned to the user, the list of the tickets present in his department and finally the list of the tickets created by the user. For each ticket, the details about the ticket, such as the ticket number, priority, age of the ticket, the company and finally the assignment details are displayed. The issue details are also shown separately for each ticket.

features.featureDescription: You can delete a record by clicking on "Del" next to the record.
You can add a record by clicking on "Add Ticket".
You can view more records in a particular section by clicking "Show More".
You can view more details by clicking on the record.
You can update a record by clicking on "Edit" next to the record.

rules.ruleDescription: Other tickets in my Department: These are records that are assigned to anyone in your department, are unassigned in your department, and are open.
Tickets assigned to me: These are records that are assigned to you and are open
Tickets created by me: These are records that have been entered by you and are open

tips.tipDescription: Make sure to resolve your tickets as soon as possible so they don't appear here!

pageDescription.title: Activity Log
pageDescription.description: This page lists the services (activities performed) rendered to a client after a ticket has been created. Each Activity Log is usually a sequence of descriptions of the work done during the business days of the week. To resolve the issues listed in a ticket, multiple activity logs (usually one for each business week) may be required.

features.featureDescription: The first activity date displays the date at which work started in an activity log and the last activity date displays the last date that work was done for the activity log.
You may view, add, edit and delete activity logs from this page based on your permissions
Adding, editing and deleting activity logs with hours counting towards a service contract changes the hours remaining in a service contract. The hours remaining is displayed in the ticket header.

pageDescription.title: Add Activity Log
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to describe the activity performed on each day in order to resolve the issue specified in the ticket.

features.featureDescription: This page is divided into the general information, per day description of service and additional information sections
The 'General Information' section displays the associated service contract.
The 'Per Day Description of Service' section that allows you to enter description of work done.
The 'Additional information' section that allows you to enter the follow up information and phone and engineer response time.

rules.ruleDescription: If the follow up field is checked, the alert date and description are mandatory.
The phone and engineer response time are text fields that allow you to enter the "time of day' when the response was made.
All fields in a row of the description of service section is mandatory.

The travel time and the labor time can be selected from the drop list. If you choose the values in these duration fields to count towards a service contract, the hours remaining in the service contract is changed accordingly when this activity log is saved.

pageDescription.title: Activity Log Details
pageDescription.description: This page displays activities performed on each day in order to resolve the issue specified in the ticket. It also displays follow up information if they are recorded during creation or modification of the activity log.

features.featureDescription: This page is divided into the general information, per day description of service and additional information sections
The travel time and the labor time in the per day description section are summed and displayed to you for reference.

pageDescription.title: Modify Activity Log
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to edit the activities performed on each day in order to resolve the issue specified in the ticket.

features.featureDescription: This page is divided into the general information, per day description of service and additional information sections
The 'General Information' section displays the associated service contract.
The 'Per Day Description of Service' section that allows you to enter description of work done.
# The 'Additional information' section that allows you to enter the follow up information and phone and engineer response time.

rules.ruleDescription: All fields in a row of the description of service section is mandatory.
If the follow up field is checked, the alert date and description are mandatory.
The phone and engineer response time are text fields that allow you to enter the "time of day' when the response was made.

The travel time and the labor time can be selected from the drop list. If you choose the values in these duration fields to count towards a service contract, the hours remaining in the service contract is changed accordingly when this activity log is saved.

pageDescription.title: Maintenance Notes
pageDescription.description: This page displays a list of maintenance notes performed on an asset.

features.featureDescription: This page displays information about an asset that is relevant for maintenance work to be done on the asset and then displays the maintenance notes for the asset created to resolve the issue recorded in the ticket.
You may view, add, edit and delete maintenance notes from this page based on your permissions.

pageDescription.title: Add Maintenance Note
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to create a maintenance note.

features.featureDescription: This page is divided into a general maintenance information section and a replacement parts section.

The general mainetenance information section allows you to enter a description relating the reason for failure of the asset, or a description relating to the neccessity to service or upgrade the asset to keep it performing optimally or to include additional features.

The replacement parts section allows you to enter the part number and a description of the part in each row. It initially displays three rows, allowing three parts to be entered. If additional parts need to be entered, you may save this maintenance note and choose to modify it. The modify page allows you to enter an additional part. Alternatively, to add more replacement parts, you may create another maintenance note.

pageDescription.title: Modify Maintenance Note
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to modify a maintenance note.

features.featureDescription: This page is divided into a general maintenance information section and a replacement parts section.

The general mainetenance information section allows you to modify the description relating the reason for failure of the asset, or a description relating to the neccessity to service or upgrade the asset to keep it performing optimally or to include additional features.

The replacement parts section allows you to enter the part number and a description of the part in each row. It displays one additional row to allow you to enter an additional replacement part. If more parts need to be entered, you may update this maintenance note and choose to modify it again. Alternatively, to add more replacement parts, you may create another maintenance note.

module.name: Employees
module.briefDescription: You are looking at the Employee module home page. This page displays the details of all the employees present in the system.
module.detailDescription:
The main feature of the employee module is the view.
View: This page displays the details of each employee, which can be viewed, modified or deleted. Each employee record contains details such as the name of the employee, their department, title and phone number. This also lets you add a new employee into the system.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: The details of each employee can be viewed, modified or deleted and a new detailed employee record can be added.

features.featureDescription: A new detailed employee record can be added.
The details of each employee can be viewed, modified or deleted using the select button in the action column.

pageDescription.title: Employee Details
pageDescription.description: This is the employee detail page. This page displays the email, phone number, addresses and additional details of each employee.

features.featureDescription: You can modify or delete the employee details using the modify or delete buttons.

pageDescription.title: Add an Employee
pageDescription.description: You can add an employee into the system. The details of the employee such as his email address; phone numbers, address and other additional details can be given along with his name

features.featureDescription: The "Save" button saves the details of the employee entered.
The "Save & New" button lets you to save the details of one employee and enter another employee in one operation.

pageDescription.title: Modify Employee Details
pageDescription.description: Employee details such as the name of the employee, email address, phone numbers and address can be modified here.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the update button saves the modified details of the employee.

pageDescription.description: This page shows the details of the employee record, which can be modified or deleted.

features.featureDescription: The employee record can be modified or deleted from the system completely.

module.name: Reports
module.briefDescription: You are looking at the Reports module home page. This page displays a list of generated reports that are ready to be downloaded. It also displays a list of reports that are scheduled to be processed by server. You can add new reports too.
module.detailDescription:
The Reports module has two main features.
Queue: Queue shows the list of reports that are scheduled to be processed by the server.
Add: This shows the different modules present and displays the list of corresponding reports present in each module, allowing you to add a report to the schedule queue.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description:
This is the home of the reports.
A list of customized reports can be viewed and the queue of the reports that are scheduled to be processed by the server are also displayed. Each report that is ready to be retrieved is displayed along with its details such as the subject of the report, the date when the report was generated, report status and finally the size of the report for the user to download.

features.featureDescription: You can cancel the reports that are scheduled to be processed by the server by the clicking the select button.
The generated reports can be deleted or viewed/downloaded in .pdf format by clicking the select button under the action column.
Add a new report

pageDescription.title: List of Modules
pageDescription.description: This shows the different modules present and displays the list of corresponding reports present in each module.

features.featureDescription: There are four different modules and you can click on the module where you want to generate the report.

pageDescription.title: Parameters specification
pageDescription.description: This page takes the parameters that need to be specified to run the report.

features.featureDescription: You can use the "generate report" button to run the report.
If the parameters exist, you can specify the name of the criteria for future reference and click the check box present at the bottom of the page.

pageDescription.title: Lis of Reports
pageDescription.description: In this module, you can choose the report that you want to run from the list of the reports.

features.featureDescription: You can run the report by clicking on the title of the report.

pageDescription.title: Criteria List
pageDescription.description: You can choose to base this report on previously saved criteria, or continue and create new criteria.

features.featureDescription: If the criteria are present, select the criteria, then continue to enter the parameters to run the report.

pageDescription.title: Reports Added To Queue
pageDescription.description: This page shows that the requested report is added to the queue. Also lets you know the details about the report and queue status.

features.featureDescription: You can view the queue either by using the link in the text or using the view queue button.
You can cancel the report that is scheduled to be processed by the server by clicking the select button and selecting "Cancel".
You can view the reports generated, download them or delete them by clicking on the select button under the action column.
A new report can be generated by clicking on the link "Add a Report".

module.name: Admin
module.briefDescription: The admin module lets the user review the system usage, configure modules, and configure the global/system parameters.
module.detailDescription:
This Admin System has five main features.
Users: This section allows the administrator to view and add users and manage user hierarchies. The users are typically employees in your company who interact with your clients or customers, but can be outsides that you have granted permissions on the system.
Roles: This page lists the different roles you have defined in the system, their role description and the number of people present in the system who carry out that role. New roles can be added into the system at any time.
Modules: This page lets you configure various parameters in the modules that meet the needs of your organization, including configuration of lookup lists and custom fields. There are four types of modules. Each module has different number of configure options. The changes in the module affect all the users.
System: You can configure the system for the session timeout and set the time limit for the time out.
Usage: Current System Usage and Billing Usage Information are displayed.

pageDescription.title: List of Users
pageDescription.description: This section allows the administrator to view and add users and manage user hierarchies. The users are typically employees in your company who interact with your clients or customers.

features.featureDescription: The alphabetical slide rule allows users to be listed based on their last name. Simply click on the starting letter desired.
The columns "Name", 'Username" and "Role" can be clicked to display the users in the ascending or descending order of the chosen criteria.
The "Add New User" link opens a window that allows the administrator to add new users.

The "select" buttons in the "Action" column alongside the name of each user opens a pop-up menu that provides the administrator with options to view more information, modify user information, or disable (or inactivate) the user.

The list is displayed with 10 names per page by default. Additional items in the list may be viewed by clicking on the "Previous" and "Next" navigation links at the bottom of the table or by changing the number of items to be displayed per page.
The users of the CRM system are listed in alphabetical order. Their user name, role and who they report to are also listed to provide a quick overview of information for each user.

The drop list provides a filter to either view only the active or only the inactive users. Inactive users are those who do not have the privilege to use the system currently either because their user names have been disabled or they have expired. These users may be activated (enabled) at a later time.

pageDescription.title: Adding a New User
pageDescription.description: This form allows new users to be added to the system and records their contact information.

features.featureDescription: The 'Reports To" field allows the administrator to setup a user hierarchy. The drop list displays all the users of the system and allows one to be chosen.
The "Role" drop list allows a role to be associated with a user. This association determines the privileges the user may have when he accesses the system.

The "Password" fields allows the administrator to setup a password for the user. The password is used along with the Username to login to the system. Since the password is stored in encrypted form and cannot be interpreted, the administrator is asked to confirm the users password. The user may subsequently change his password according to personal preferences.
The Username is the phrase that is used by the user to login to the system. It must be unique.

An "Expire Date" may be set for each user after which the user is disabled. If this field is left blank the user is active indefinitely. This date can either be typed in the mm/dd/yyyy format or chosen from a calendar that can be accessed from the icon at the right of the field.

The contact field allows the administrator to associate contact information with the user. The administrator may either create new contact information or choose one from the existing list of contacts. This information provides the administrator with the user's e-mail, telephone and (or) fax number, postal address and any other information that may help the administrator or the system manager to contact the user.

pageDescription.title: Modify User Details
pageDescription.description: This form provides the administrator with an editable view of the user information, and also allows the administrator to view the users login history and view points.

features.featureDescription: The "Cancel" button allows current and uncommitted changes to be undone.
When the "Generate new password" field is checked, the system constructs a password for the user and uses the contact information to email the new password to the user.
The "Disable" button provides a quick link to the administrator to disable the user.
The "Username", "Role", "Reports To" and password of the user are editable. For more information about each of these fields see help on "Add user".

pageDescription.title: User Login History
pageDescription.description: Provides a login history of the chosen user.

features.featureDescription: The list is displayed by default with 10 items per page, additional items in the login history may be viewed by clicking on the "Previous" and "Next" navigation links at the bottom of the table or by changing the number of items to be displayed on a page.
The login history of the user displays the IP address of the computer from which the user logged in, and the date/time when the user logged in.

pageDescription.title: Viewpoints of User
pageDescription.description: The page displays the viewpoints of the employees regarding a particular module in the system. Lets you add a new viewpoint. The details displayed are when the viewpoint was entered and whether it is enabled or not.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the select button under the action column would let you to view the details about the viewpoint also modify them.
You can click on the contact under the viewpoint column to know more details about that viewpoint and its permissions.
You can add a new viewpoint using the link "Add New Viewpoint".

pageDescription.title: Add Viewpoint
pageDescription.description: The contact name can be selected and the permissions /access for the modules can be given.

features.featureDescription: You can add a new viewpoint by any employee by clicking the add button.
The permissions for the different modules can be given by checking the Access checkbox.
The contact can be selected and removed using the links "change contact" and "clear contact".

pageDescription.title: Update Viewpoint
pageDescription.description: You can update a viewpoint and set the permissions to access different modules.

features.featureDescription: The details can be updated using the update button.
You can also set the permissions to access different modules by checking the check box under the Access column.
You can enable the viewpoint by checking the "Enabled" checkbox.

pageDescription.title: List of Roles
pageDescription.description:
You are looking at roles.
This page lists the different roles present in the system, their role descriptions and the number of people present in the system who are assigned that role. New roles can be added at any time.

features.featureDescription: You can also click the select button under the action column to view or modify the details of roles.
Clicking on the role name gives you details about the role and the permissions it provides.
You can add a new role into the system.

pageDescription.title: Add a New Role
pageDescription.description: This page will let you Add/Update the roles in the system. Also lets you change the permissions. The permissions can be changed or set for each module separately depending on the role.

features.featureDescription: Clicking the update button updates the role.

pageDescription.title: Update Role
pageDescription.description: This page will let you update the roles in the system. Also lets you change the permissions. The permissions can be changed or set for each module separately depending on the role.

features.featureDescription: The update of the role can be done by clicking the update button.

pageDescription.title: Configure Modules
pageDescription.description: This page lets you configure modules that meet the needs of your organization, including configuration of lookup lists and custom fields. Depending on permissions, each module that you can configure is listed and each module has a different number of configure options. The changes typically affect all users immediately.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the module name will display a list of module items that can be configured.

pageDescription.title: Configuration Options
pageDescription.description: You can configure different options in each module.The following are some of the configuration options that you might see in the modules. Some of these options are specific to the module so they might NOT be present in all the modules.

features.featureDescription: Scheduled Events: A timer triggers a customizable workflow process.
Object Events: An Action triggers customizable workflow process. For example, when an object is inserted, updated, deleted or selected, a process is triggered.
Categories: This lets you create hierarchical categories for a specific feature in the module.
Lookup Lists: You can view the drop-down lists used in the module and make changes.
Custom Folders and Fields: Custom folders allows you to create forms that will be present within each module, essentially custom fields.

pageDescription.title: Edit Lookup List
pageDescription.description: This page lets you edit and add to the list items.

features.featureDescription: You can create a new item type using the add button and add it to the existing list. You can position the item in the list using the up and down buttons, remove it using the remove button and also sort the list. The final changes can be saved using the "Save Changes" button.

pageDescription.title: Adding a New Folder
pageDescription.description: Add/Update the existing folder here

features.featureDescription: You can update the existing the folder, set the options for the records and the permissions for the users.

pageDescription.title: Modify Existing Folder
pageDescription.description: Update the existing folder here

features.featureDescription: You can update the existing the folder, set the options for the records and the permissions for the users.

pageDescription.title: Configure System
pageDescription.description: You can configure the system for the session idle timeout and set the time for the time out.

features.featureDescription: The "Edit" link will let you alter the time for which the users session ends.

pageDescription.title: Modify Timeout
pageDescription.description: The session timeout is the time in which a user will automatically be logged out if the specified period of inactivity is reached.

features.featureDescription: The time out can be set by selecting the time from the drop down and clicking the update button.

pageDescription.title: Resource Usage Details
pageDescription.description: Current System Usage and Billing Usage Information are displayed.

features.featureDescription: The usage can be displayed for the current date or a custom date can be specified. This can be selected from the drop down of the date range.
The start date and the end date can be specified if the date range is "custom date range". The update can be done using the update button.

pageDescription.title: Custom Folders
pageDescription.description: This page lists all the custom folders created in the General Contacts; let's you edit them and also allow you to enable/disable the folders.

features.featureDescription: You can also enable or disable the custom folders by clicking "yes" or "no".
Clicking on the custom folder will give details about that folder and also lets you add groups.
You can update an existing folder using the edit button under the action column.
You can update an existing folder using the edit button under the action column.
Add a folder to the general contacts module.

pageDescription.title: List of Custom Folders
pageDescription.description: This page lists all the custom folders created in the General Contacts; let's you edit them and also allow you to enable/disable the folders.

features.featureDescription: You can also enable or disable the custom folders by clicking "yes" or "no".
You can update an existing folder using the edit button under the action column.
Clicking on the custom folder will give details about that folder and also lets you add groups.
You can update an existing folder using the edit button under the action column.
Add a folder to the general contacts module.

pageDescription.title: Object Events:
pageDescription.description: The list of Object Events are displayed along with the corresponding Triggered Processes. The number of components and whether that Object Event is available or not is also shown.

features.featureDescription: You can view the process details by clicking on the select button under the Action column or by clicking on the name of the Triggered Process.
You can view the process details by clicking on the select button under the Action column or by clicking on the name of the Triggered Process.

pageDescription.description: Add a group

features.featureDescription: You can add a group name and save it using the "save" button.

pageDescription.description: The Lookup List displays all the list names, which can be edited, the number of items can be known and the ones present can be previewed.

features.featureDescription: You can click "Edit" in the Action column to update or delete a contact type.
You can preview all the items present in a List name using the drop down in the preview column.

pageDescription.title: Lookup Lists
pageDescription.description: The Lookup List displays all the list names, which can be edited, the number of items is displayed and the ones present can be previewed.

features.featureDescription: You can click "Edit" in the Action column to update or delete a contact type.
You can preview all the items present in a List name using the drop down in the preview column.

pageDescription.title: Folder Details
pageDescription.description: This page lists the folder details and the groups added to this folder. Each group can further have a custom field created or deleted. You can also place it in the desired position in the dropdown list.

features.featureDescription: You can also delete the folder and all the fields using the "Delete this folder and all fields" at the bottom of the page.
The groups can also be moved up or down using the "Up" and "Down". They can also be edited and deleted using the "Edit" and "Del" links.
The custom field can also be edited and deleted using the corresponding links "Edit" and "Del".
The custom field created can be moved up or down for the display using the corresponding links "Up" and "Down".
You can add a custom field for the group using the "Add a custom field" link.
Add a group to the folder selected
You can select the folder by using the drop down box under the general contacts module.

pageDescription.title: Active Category Details
pageDescription.description: The four different levels for the "Active" and "Draft" categories are displayed. The level1 has the category name, which is further classified into sub directories/levels. The level1 has the sublevel called level2 which in turn has sublevel called level3 and so on.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the list of categories displayed in level1 shows you its sub levels or sub-directories present in level2 and clicking on these in turn shows its subdirectories in level3 and so on.
You can select to display either the Active Categories or the Draft Categories by clicking on the tabs "Active Categories" and "Draft Categories" respectively.

pageDescription.title: Draft Category Details
pageDescription.description: The four different levels for the active and the draft categories are displayed. The level1 has the category name, which is further classified into sub directories/levels. The level1 has the sublevel called level2 which in turn has sublevel called level3 and so on. The draft categories can be edited and activated. The activated draft categories would be then reflected in the Active Categories list. The modified/updated draft category can also be reverted to its original state.

features.featureDescription: The activated list can be brought back / reverted to the active list by clicking the "Revert to Active List".
You can activate each level by using the "Activate now" button.
In the draft categories you can edit your category using the edit button present at the bottom of each level.
You can select to display either the Active Categories or the Draft Categories by clicking on the tabs "Active Categories" and "Draft Categories" respectively.

Clicking on the list of categories displayed in level1 shows you its sub-levels or sub-directories present in level2 and clicking on these in turn would shows their subdirectories in level3 and so on.

pageDescription.title: User Details
pageDescription.description: This form provides the administrator with more information about the user, namely information pertaining to the users login history and view points.

features.featureDescription: The "Modify" button in the "Details" tab provides a quick link that allows the users information to be modified without having to browse back to the previous window.
The "Employee Link" in the 'Primary Information" table header provides a quick link to view the user's contact information.
The "Details" tab displays the information about the user in a non-editable format.
The "Disable" button provides a quick link to disable/inactivate the user.

pageDescription.title: Overview
pageDescription.description: You are looking at the Admin module home page. Here you can manage the system by reviewing its usage, configuring specific modules and system parameters.

features.featureDescription: The user and module section allows the administrator to manage users, roles, role hierarchy and manage modules.
The global parameters and server configuration module allows the administrator to set the session timeout parameter.
The usage section allows the administrator to view the total number of users, memory used, and system usage parameters for various time intervals.
The administration module is divided into distinct categories such as managing users, module configuration, setting global parameters, server configuration and monitoring system usage and resources.

pageDescription.title: General Search
pageDescription.description: You can search the system for data associated with a particular key term. This can be done using the search data text box present on the left side of the window. The data associated with the corresponding key term is looked for in different modules for a match and the results are displayed per module. The search results are shown with detail description.

features.featureDescription: Clicking on the different links of the search results will direct you to the corresponding details in the modules.

pageDescription.title: a
pageDescription.description: b

module.name: Projects
module.briefDescription: The Project management module allows individuals and organizations to share up-to-the-minute information with others. Whether you are sharing information with employees, clients, vendors, friends, and family, the information is easily and securely accessible.

pageDescription.title: Dashboard
pageDescription.description:
This page provides a snap shot of all recent items (of the last 7 days) of all the projects that a you are a member of.
By changing the filter, you can choose to view information over a longer time period (14 days or 30 days), or a shorter time period(24hrs or 48hrs.)
The menu allows you to add a project, search for information in projects, list existing projects, and view invitations to join projects

pageDescription.title: Add Project
pageDescription.description:
This page allows you to create a new project.
The following fields are requested: 1. Title - A brief name for your project. 2. Short Description - A brief description for your project 3. Start Date - The date in which the project started or will start 4. Estimated End Date - The date in which you believe the project will be finished . 5. Requested By - The name of a person that may have initiated the reason for the project; could be the name of a client. 6. Organization - The organization that may have initiated the reason for the project; could be the name of a company. 7. Budget - A high-level view of the project budget; this figure generally is an estimate. 8. Status - Specifies whether the project has been approved or if it is closed (finished.)
Once the fields have been successfully submitted, a new project is created. You should see the name of the project you created and several tabs underneath that will contain all the information for your project.

pageDescription.title: Invitations
pageDescription.description: This page displays the projects to which you have been invited to. By accepting an invitation, you become a team member of the project and assume a role (applicable to this project alone) assigned by the owner (or creator) of the project.

pageDescription.title: Search
pageDescription.description: This page allows you to search for items in a project based on the search item. For advanced search options, you may click on the "tips" link.

pageDescription.title: Project Details
pageDescription.description:
This view displays information about a project.
The General Information section displays the project status, the title (also the project name), a description, the budget and relevant dates (start date, entered, modified and estimated close date) for the project.

pageDescription.title: Setup
pageDescription.description:
Within the Setup tab you also have the choice to either "Configure Permissions" or "Customize Project" for this project.
Configuring Permissions allows you to define what members of your project can be allowed to view, add, change, or delete.
Customizing the project allows you to show(or hide) the tabs and change the tab names according to your preferences.

pageDescription.title: Customize Project Module
pageDescription.description:
This "Customize Project" view allows you to change the names for each of the project subtabs. Changing the names of the tabs does not change any of the existing functionality for that tab.
It also allows you to turn off the subtabs based on your preferences. Turning tabs off can be helpful if you do not intend to have any information under that tab. Making things simple for your team members certainly helps to streamline the usage of your project.

pageDescription.title: Configure Permissions
pageDescription.description:
The "Configure Permissions" screen shows you a list of all permissions that can be adjusted in your project. Each tab is represented and has a variety of permissions that can be adjusted.
For example, the first group is entitled, Project Details, which contains three permissions that can be adjusted: 1. View project details defines which role(s) can view the project Details tab. 2. Modify project details defines which role(s) can modify the information on the project Details tab. 3. Delete project defines which role(s) can permanently delete this project
The screen also allows you to define what members of your project can be allowed to view, add, change, or delete. Later on, when you add users to your project, you will need to know the answer to what will each user be able to access in my project?

features.featureDescription: Users can be assigned one of the following roles, namely, Guest, Observer, Contributor and Project Lead. The Guest role is the least privileged role in a project and the Project Lead role is the most privileged role.

When a role is allowed a permission, the permission is also available to more privileged roles. For e.g., if a the permission "View project details" is allowed for the "Guest", all superior roles namely, Observer, Contributor and Project Lead also inherit this permission. Similarly, if the "Modify Project Details" is assigned to "Project Lead" no other role inherits this privilege as the "Project Lead" role is the most superior (as in most privileged) role among preconfigured roles in the projects module.

pageDescription.title: News
Add News
pageDescription.description: This screen allows you to add a news item.

features.featureDescription: This page contains the following fields

Status: Determines whether the article is shown when users view news articles; there are three possible choices: a) Draft if you are not finished with composing the article, choose Draft and you can finish the article later; even though you will see this article in your Current News list, other users will not unless they have access to to view Draft articles b)Unapproved if you are finished, but would like the article to be approved before allowing others to view, choose Unapproved; even though you will see this article in your Current News list, others will not unless they have access to view Unapproved articles c)Published indicates that the article is finished, approved, and ready to be seen by other users.

Position: Articles are typically displayed in the list by the most recent date first; if you would like certain articles to appear before others, no matter what their date is set to, then you can group them by position in which lower numbered articles always appear before higher numbered articles; by default 10 is used for all articles, so a number of 1-9 would appear before 10.

Start Date/Time: The specific date and time in which the article should be allowed to be viewed; prior to this time, only users who can see unreleased articles have access to this article; when the date/time occurs, the article will automatically be visible in Current News for the rest of the users in your project with access to the News Article list.
Archive Date/Time: The specific date and time in which the article should automatically be archived from the default view; users who have access to archived articles will be able to review these.
Subject: Each article needs a headline that gets displayed.

Intro: Each article can have an unlimited amount of text, however you might want to have an introduction to the article and require that the user choose to read any additional pages by selecting a read more link that appears when an article has an additional page.
Once you have finished your news article, and have completed the fields, choose to Save the article. If you would like to add an additional page to the article, choose Save and Add a Page.
Viewing the News tab will now show your article.

pageDescription.title: Team
pageDescription.description: Lists the currently added team members and some information about them. You will always be added when you create a new project.

pageDescription.title: Setup
pageDescription.description:
Within the Setup tab you also have the choice to Configure Permissions for this project. Permissions allow you to define what members of your project can be allowed to view, add, change, or delete.
To setup team members, choose the Modify Team link. At this point you will now have a page with four (4) lists, some of which are empty. The right most list shows you the team members of your project. The left most list shows you ways in which you can add a team member.

pageDescription.title: Manage Team
pageDescription.description:
This page allows you to modify (add and remove) members from the project team.
This page shows you four (4) lists, some of which are empty. The right most list shows you the team members of your project. The left most list shows you ways in which you can add a team member.

features.featureDescription: Team members can be invited from: 1. Open projects if you have existing projects, that are open, then you can begin by adding contacts from your open projects 2. Closed projects if you have existing projects, that have been closed, then you can begin by adding contacts from a closed project 3. Email address if the contact is not listed in one of your projects, then you can invite them by their email address.

The first list allows you to choose a method for inviting your contact. Depending on your choice, you will either be asked to choose a project in which to select a contact from, or you will be asked to input an email address. When you have selected a contact, make sure they show up in the right most list before continuing.
To remove a team member from your project, simply select them in the right column and they will be removed when the team is updated.

When you are finished modifying the team, choose Update Team to finalize the changes. If you added a contact by email address, and the CRM application is not familiar with that address, then you will be asked if you are certain you would like to invite them to the project. Choosing Yes will require that you input their first and last name.
When contacts are added to a project, whether they are users (have accounts) of CRM or not, each contact will be sent an email inviting them to your project.

When you return to the list of users, you can modify their role in the project by using the drop-down menu next to their name. As soon as the drop-down is changed, the system immediately updates the user's role.

All added team members are initially identified as invited. This means that you would like them to be on this project, but the contact will need to be informed of this action and asked to accept the invitation. If the contact does not have an account, then they will receive an email that allows them to easily obtain an account before accepting your invitation.

pageDescription.title: Discussion
pageDescription.description:
While news articles provide a formal way to announce and disseminate project happenings, discussion groups allow for more informal camaraderie and collaboration.
Discussion groups are comprised of forums, topics and messages.
Forums provide some sort of categorization among what is being discussed. For example, you might have forums for Suggestions, Status Reports and Resources. Small projects might have just one forum, while larger projects may require multiple forums.
Once a forum has been created, it's time to create a topic for discussion. A topic is simply a subject and a message. Forums can have multiple topics in which users can reply to and comment on.
Once a topic has been posted, other team members can reply.

pageDescription.title: Documents
pageDescription.description:
The Projects module comes with a sophisticated document management tool. You can use it to store versions of documents in a hierarchy of folders. When you select the Documents tab you are presented with a list of folders and files that belong to the project.
To create a folder, select the New Folder link. To store a file, select the Submit File link. When uploading a file you can specify a subject for the file that gets displayed in the list. You can store documents at the top level, or you can navigate into any available folder and then store a file there.
Once a file exists in the document library, you will see it appear in the list. By choosing the Select button next to the file, you are presented with several options,namely
1. View File History: Viewing the file's history shows the versions that exist for a file and how many times each version has been downloaded. 2. Download File: This will begin downloading the file to your computer. 3. View File Contents: The file will be displayed in a popup window; only certain types can be displayed, for example PDF, Excel, HTML, Text, and Word documents. 4. Rename File: This will allow you to modify the subject of a file. 5. Add Version: This allows you to upload a new version to an existing document; the existing file will not be altered and can be downloaded or deleted separately; version numbers can be indicated as: (a) Major - Generally a substantial amount of content has been added or modified (b) Minor - Generally some amount of content has been added or modified (c) Changes - Generally a small amount of content has been added or modified. 6. Move File: This allows you to move the file to another folder. 7. Delete File: This will delete the file and all versions of the file; to delete just a version of the file. You can choose the View File History link for additional options

pageDescription.title: Lists
pageDescription.description:
Lists allow you to place items on a list that you can mark as incomplete or complete.
Projects can have any number of lists and each list can have any number of items. An item on the list can also have a memo area if necessary.
Lists are good for jotting down related items to be referenced later. While to-do items can be added to the list and checked off, they can also be done in the Plan or Tickets tabs.

pageDescription.title: Project Plan
pageDescription.description:
The plan tab is perhaps the most functionally rich feature of the projects module.
Plans can be used for creating a high-level view of project milestones or objectives and then proceeding to low-level details.
1. Start with an outline. Outlines can be used to organize objectives for the project. To create a new outline, click the "New Outline" link. You are presented a number of fields that allow you to describe all the information for the outline.
2. Detail the outline with activities and assignments.

features.featureDescription: This page lists all the project plans. Each item in the list provides a snapshot of the outline including the outline's start date, the start date, the description and status, the progress made in completing the items of the outline and the effort expended in completing the items of the outline.
Using the drop list as a filter you can choose to view only open outlines, only closed outlines or view all outlines.
When you click on the select option, you are presented with a choice view, edit or delete the outline.

pageDescription.title: Add Outline
pageDescription.description:
This page allows you to add an outline. Listed below is a description of the fields shown in this screen.
a) Title - a project milestone to be displayed. b) Requested By - The name of a person that may have initiated the reason for the milestone; could be the name of a client. c) Department or Company - The organization that may have initiated the reason for the milestone; could be the name of a company. d) Expected Dates - The date in which the milestone is expected to begin and the date in which the milestone is expected to be completed on. e) Level of Effort - An estimate as to how much time this milestone could take, and a field for how long the milestone actual took. f) Status - Indicates whether the outline is approved and/or closed (complete.) g) Details - Text describing the goals of this outline
When all required fields of the screen are entered, you can save the outline. The saved outline appears in the outline list.
Once you create the outline, the next task would be to elaborate the outline with activities and assignments.

pageDescription.title: Plan Outline
pageDescription.description:
This page allows you to view outline details, add activities, and activity folders
When you click on the name of the outline, a drop-down menu appears with the option to a) Add Activity Folder b) Add Activity
An Activity Folder allows you to create sections in your outline. This can be useful when you are building the outline and haven't yet decided how to group Activities.
Activities are specific items to be completed toward this project objective or milestone.
Activities have several fields: a) Description - A specific task to be completed; this will be displayed on the outline. b) Indent Level - since the outline is hierarchical, each item on the outline can be moved to the left or right; by selecting the left/right arrows the indent level will increase and decrease; items with a higher number then the item above will appear indented. c) Priority - Indicates the importance of this activity; there are three (3) options: A Low, A Normal (default,) A High. d) Assigned To - The activity can be assigned to any member of the project. e) Status - Describes the state of this activity; there are six (6) options: (i)A Not Started (ii)A In Progress (iii)A Complete (iv)A Closed - Similar to complete, but used when the activity may no longer be necessary and the item was not completed. (v) A On Hold - Indicates that this activity is waiting on some other factor; for example, another activity needs to be completed before this one. (vi)A Waiting on Requirements - Indicates that more information is needed in order to complete this activity. f) Keywords - additional words to keep track of activities; for example, maybe the expected output of this activity: Excel, Java, Press Release, etc.; a future version of the software might allow for searching keywords. g) Level of Effort - The estimated time it should take for this activity to be completed; an additional field is used to record the actual time this activity took. h) Due Date - The date in which this activity should be completed by.
When all of the information on the activity has been recorded, choose Save or Save & New. Save will simply record the activity, and refresh the outline. Save & New will record the activity, refresh the outline, and then provide another form to continue adding activities.
Once an activity is in the list, you can select the activity from the list and a menu will appear with the following options: a) Arrow buttons - The arrows allow you to move this Activity item up and down the list, or indent the activity to the left and right. b) Add Activity Folder - Adds an Activity Folder below this Activity. c) Add Activity - Adds another Activity below this one. d) View/Update this Activity - Depending on your permissions, and whether the activity is assigned to you, you can modify the activity, otherwise you can only view the activity without making changes. e) Delete Activity

pageDescription.title: Tickets
pageDescription.description:
Once the project gets going, you might run into some unexpected issues that need to be recorded and resolved. The Tickets tab is a good place to capture these.
This page displays a list of tickets for this project. Each item in the list gives a snapshot of the information of the ticket.
The list can be filtered to view only the open tickets, only the closed tickets or to view all tickets.
The snapshot includes, the ticket Id, the status, the ticket issue (only partially displayed if it is elaborate,) the priority, the team member it was assigned to, the age of ticket and when the ticket was last modified.
The displayed list can be sorted based on all the underlined column headers of the list.

pageDescription.title: Add Ticket
pageDescription.description:
Tickets are issues that can be assigned to a team member. A ticket has the following fields: 1. Issue - The complete issue that has come up; this can be a request for information or a problem that has occurred, be specific without adding comments. 2. Severity - Describes the impact on the project using one of three (3) choices: (a) Normal (b) Important (c) Critical 3. Priority - Describes when the issue should be resolved, possibly ahead of other issues; there are three (3) choices: (a) Scheduled - The team member assigned should schedule this issue and take care of it when convenient. (b) Next - The team member assigned should take care of this issue ahead of other lower priority items. (c) Immediate - The team member assigned should take care of this issue right away, typically because the impact is severe. 4. Assign To - The team member that has been assigned this ticket. 5. User Comments - Any additional comments to provide that are not part of the issue; a ticket can have any number of comments; each comment is dated and attributed to the user that made a comment and can later be seen in the ticket history. 6. Solution - A description of how this ticket was resolved. 7. Close Ticket Indicates whether this ticket is complete and needs no further action.
Once a ticket has been added, its details can be reviewed. A ticket also has a history in which you can see the progress or escalation that has occurred with the ticket. Once a ticket has been closed, it can be re-opened later, if necessary.
